review: One of my favorite CPKs. The servers have always been attentive, and the food is as good as it gets at a chain restaurant. We usually split the Thai Crunch Salad with avocado and a Wild Mushroom pizza. The two really don't sound like they pair together, but that's how we roll and they are yummy. The last time we were there we deviated from the norm, and ordered the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine and the Tuscan Hummus. Both were just ok. The fettuccine was a bit bland and the hummus was watery. The pita was delish though!
Hello CPK is always a hit but this one had FAST service, friendly staff and close to shopping!!  You can't go wrong with this one!

My wife and I went this sunday, no complaints. The service was great, not to rushed, not to pressured. The food is pretty good, many many choices. I went with the Tequila Chicken (pasta dish) and that was perfect.

I love this location because there is never a line and everyone we come in contact with is super friendly and nice.  Same as other CPK's... without the line! There has been no complaints about the food or service and that is why they are getting a 5. I love CPK. :)
Mmmmmm....Mac-n-cheese! We were in a hurry and our waiter was able to get us in & out in 30 minutes! We also had a meat cravers pizza and pesto cream penne with chicken and shrimp.

I love the place because close my home. And the to go very easy I can order thru website and pick up in 30 mins. My kids love the kunposhirmp with chicken noodle...Chinese chicken salad...we love CPK.

Good food plus a star for tonight's service It's been a while since we've been here and came to celebrate a birthday. We got the grilled vegetable sandwich, Soup combo - artichoke and broccoli soup and the caramelized peach salad, Chinese chicken salad, mac&cheese, Also got the ultimate margarita but found it to be ho-hum. Seems like the service here is hit-or-miss. Not tonight. Vanessa, our server was friendly, personable, and attentive. She knew her menu very well and was able to focus on customer service. She interacted with us and checked-up on us regularly and made sure our drinks were filled and our food was good. Overall, 3 stars for the food +1 star for tonight's service.
Like how they make you wait 10-15 minutes to be seated despite 8 tables being open?  Not the CPK I am used to.

In short... BBQ chicken chopped salad - crisp, cold, fresh, and delish! Sicilian pizza - ultra thin crust, meaty and semi-spicy, great! Fried mac n cheese - not as exciting as I hoped... it was lacking flavor despite being fried. Korean tacos - tasty sauce and overall, was a-ok Mango iced tea - surprisingly delicious! Service - friendly and efficient

Super clean restaurant Super nice staff Super good food: Mediterranean Pizza, Ravioli, and avocado egg roles are to die for its pretty healthy option for a sit in joint and the price isn't too crazy. I recommend this place  for a light to medium lunch.

I love California Pizza Kitchens! This CPK was cool - friends and I were seated right away at a 1pm lunch on a Saturday afternoon. Even though there wasn't a lot of people in the restaurant, the waiter took a while to take the tables' drink orders.  Today we ordered: -   Chicken Pizza -   Pepperoni and Sausage Pizza -   Arugula salad with candied walnuts, topped with Salmon This place use to have complimentary bread, which you still do, but now the bread is upon request. The pizzas were dependable seeing that it was tasty and filling. The salad was okay, the biggest issue I had with the greens was the quality of the salmon. The salmon tasted like it might have been previously frozen, the meat was a little tough and it had a fishy taste to it.  Personal Favorites: -   Sicilian Pizza -   Waldorf Salad -   BBQ chicken Pizza There was one thing I couldn't shake today, the rest of our party paid in cash and then  my boyfriend put his card down to pay the remaining balance of $24. When the receipt came back, the waiter put the ENTIRE tab on the credit card and still took the cash, it was as if he pocketed the cash and tried to put everything on the card. How does that even happen? I was really disgruntled. Minus a half star.

Came here on a Friday at 2ish.  No wait. Our party had 7 people, so we were seated at the biggest table. We ordered:  -Pepperoni pizza -wild mushroom pizza -Spaghetti Bolognese -Spinach and asparagus pasta with salmon -Margherita pizza -original bbq chicken pizza All the orders came out at the same time, so that was good. As for the food itself, my Margherita pizza was okay. Not enough flavor. My friends Pepperoni pizza looked good, and she devoured it so I'm guessing she enjoyed it very much. I got to try the wild mushroom pizza and I have to say, I was impressed. It was my favorite pizza. Very nice and smoky mushroom taste. As for the bolognese, my friend said it was very delicious, so I would recommend it. Spinach and asparagus pasta, ehhh. It was okay. Not worth $15. Go to cheesecake factory or olive garden instead. Original bbq chicken pizza, so good! Definitely get this along with the wild mushroom pizza. The complimentary bread was crap. Cold, dry baguette.  Service was great, our water was constantly refilled.  We got our checks back quickly, too. Overall, a satisfying meal.

Lousy food. I shouldn't have to take my food home and "fix it". My fusilli was so dry, some of the noodles weren't even covered with the so-called meat sauce. Too many non-Italian items on menu, only a few of them good.  Their only saving grace is their pizzas. 2nd visit in 5 years, I'm done with CPK.
Service has improved greatly. We ordered shrimp zucchini fettuccine, Hawaiian pizza and artichoke dip. All three items were tasty.

Love me some CPK! They have good a good vegitarian selection, which can be hard to find sometimes. I think it's great that they have so many diffrent funsion types of pizzas, my favorite is the Tostada Pizza. It's diffrent and good! The food may not be like a fancy pizzaria but for the price and the fact that its a chain its really good. If you are dissapointed with your dish you can just exchange it. So far all the servers ive had have geen great. I love comming here!

Wow, I could get better pizza from a freezer.  The "Works Pizza" left me wanting a Digornio's or even a couple Jeno's pizzas (remember those?).  This CPK pizza was sorely disappointing. And it's not like I have never had good CPK before - we used to eat here all the time and be impressed with the quality of their pizza.  Now I'm not sure. My wife and I were excited to have a date all by ourselves (without our toddler son). Since we had a gift card to CPK, we decided to come here.  My wife's goat cheese pizza was pretty decent, although I can't stand more than one slice of goat cheese.  My "Works" pizza looked like it came out of the microwave.  The crust was so thin it barely hold everything together, and it was very bland.  The olives, mushrooms and peppers were just hastily thrown on and not well-integrated with the pizza. I understand that you can't just leave these items in the whole time while cooking, but can they just be cooked just a tiny bit?   There should have been much, much more meat (sausage and pepperoni).  I think the total amount of meat on the pizza was probably the size of a regular meatball you'd get on any spaghetti pizza.  This pizza left me wanting, wanting, wanting.   Yikes, not sure you can charge this amount for such a subpar pizza. CPK used to be so much better than this! Looking forward to a next time where they will prove my review wrong!

Came here a couple nights ago, it was a Thursday a little over an hour before closing. There were only 2 other small tables and we were seated asap. Ordered and got our food pretty quick. We weren't even done yet and our waitress came by with our bill (that's fine, I do that when I'm Serving at my restaurant sometimes too) and asked us if we wanted boxes. We were obviously still eating; I still had a slice of pizza in my hand and I was chewing. If it was 20-30 minutes before closing then I get it. But it wasn't, and the other 2 tables were still there chatting when we left. -2 stars for trying to rush us out when it was not busy, just a small party of 2 with a small order, and not even that close to closing yet. She seemed happiest when I said "no change," then she suddenly became super enthusiastic and said OH THANK YOU! Still gave 20% 'cause I work in a restaurant too; hope that this was just a bad day for you and not consistent.

The service was strained, but the place was near packed. The food was very yummy--we had a Thai pizza, a salad pizza, and a pasta. The refillable drinks are a better choice than the iced lemonades! Always pick the refillable drink! They are such a better value and option. If I wasn't trying to break the ice, I was wishing I had more to drink. The mango flavor was nice, though.
Curbside pickup is da best! Good solid quality!   Joey pours a great Jack Black on the rocks!

Dropped by tonight and had the caramelized peach salad with chicken and the four cheese raviolli.  Great dinner after the game.  This is one of my favorite CPKs. The service is always friendly and they never rush you even if you stay past closing time.

I don't know if their shrinking menu was a good idea. I can't seem to find a fav anymore since the "sundried tomato fusilli" is gone and their new items don't look too appetizing. Food overall is (3.5 stars). (4 stars): Still love the tortilla spring rolls Baja style, and it's my number one fav here in terms of their appetizers (even though the waiter told me its premade - frozen and they just bake it). But it's still good, so I eat it anyway!  (4 stars): They changed their free bread offer when you first arrive, instead of just bread and butter, they give you soft cut rolls with oil and herbs mixed in which is really good and much better than what they offered before.  (3 stars): Chicken tequila lime pasta was good, I asked for light sauce which I'm glad I did because it was already strong with flavor and just right.  Overall it's a good place but I'm not sure if its my favorite restaurant anymore.  (5 stars): Employees are all nice, our server was very attentive and was always there to ask if we needed anything. And they open the door for you and welcome you in as soon as you get to the entrance which is really nice and welcoming.

I've been to a couple CPKs before and my best friend used to work there, so paying for CPK was already a big deal. Ordered two salads, two pizzas, and a pasta. Everything was good. But that's about it.  I ordered the wild mushroom pizza with chicken. They brought it out at first on a thin crust, NBD, I love thin crust and forgot to order it that way, they forgot the chicken. About two minutes later my pizza appeared again with chicken. HOW MAGICAL! I could've thrown chicken on top, but I was expecting a new pizza. Whatever, I ate it.  Couple minutes later, my brother was eating the pizza and pulled out a piece of plastic. WONDERFUL.  Spoke to the server who got the manager, all of which were very apologetic and accommodating but c'mon THERE WAS PLASTIC IN MY PIZZA. Three pizzas later, and $30 off the check, I left there..meh..don't think I'm returning

Went here for lunch and the service here is horrible, especially on the weekends.  We shared the bbq chicken salad which was okay....it needed more dressing in my opinion. But my fave salad is the cobb salad. Definitely try their flavored lemonades, they are great and so refreshing on a hot day. My personal fave is the peach lemonade :)

Went for the first Time since we had a gift card. We were seated promptly and we ordered right away, I noticed other tables with complimentary bread I was expecting ours soon but it NEVER came. We got a salad we ordered after a long wait then we asked the waiter for bread and he said there was no more? OK... then our bland pasta came and then the OK pizza. Also drink refills came very sparsely...place sucked
Can get crowded here at time and the service gets slow.  But overall, good food.

We just had dinner at this location a few days ago and had a great experience. Seated quickly and had a great server (Brandy). Restaurant was extremely clean, orders came out quickly and correct and the food was delicious. We were treated as though our business was truly appreciated and I can say without a doubt we will return to this location. CPK has been a long-time favorite for our family but this visit made it a bigger fave for us. Good job guys!

A lot of menu and food changes not a good thing. I used to be a huge fan of this place and always crowded, not anymore. They short pour drinks, salad was dry, pizzas are smaller what else can I say. Two kids and two adults, 1 pizza, 1 salmon, 2 salads, 1 wedge salad, 1 dinner salad... My drink I sent back because of the minimal vodka in it. The raspberry lemon drop was not even full. All of this was 63.00 before tax and tip..... I am rating this a 1 star poor outing tonight at CPK.... Try something else for a night out..
Menu items have been changed and not for the better!! Smaller portions and new ingredients on old dishes that didn't need it!!

Another pizza disaster! So we go into CPK because we received a coupon via email to try their new hand tossed pizza. Since their normal pizza is so-so and not my favorite, I thought why not try something new? Especially $10 off, I'm in! We went in and were seated next to the bathrooms and the kitchen. There was plenty of ample seating and you put us in the loudest place? Really? That was weird. We ordered the spinach artichoke dip and it was OK. It wasn't very creamy and overly spinached. The SO loves spinach but I was thinking where's the cheese? I would not order again. Then, we order their new hand tossed pizzas. I order the veggie pizza with goat cheese and I get a pizza without.  The chef came out and apologized but it was way after I wanted to start eating, so I didn't really stress about it. The whole wheat crust was just plain gross and the pizza was frankly, nothing I would order again. And last, we get the bill and show the coupon to our server. She can't find me in their system (which takes about 20 minutes) and then the manager comes over. She says we needed to print the coupon (my bad) but she will print for me. Then, she can't find my account to print it. I'm thinking.. well, I received the coupon because I signed up online.  Either way, she took the money off the bill but the whole process took 30 minutes.  Sub par food, poor choices on the part of the hostesses and drama with their coupons. I'll pass next time!

DO NOT-and I state again-DO NOT, eat at this place. I ordered a simple margarita pizza with onions and I couldn't get past the first bite.  The cheese was all blobbed up on the crust, the tomato sauce wasn't evenly spread and the pizza just didnt have that "pizza taste". The cheese had some weird taste. Never ever again am i going to eat at California pizza kitchen again. Terrible food.

The waiter here was very friendly, I am from the LA county however this one out of all the ones we've been to is the greatest! I will come back here for the service. Of course the food is not 'super' however they do have a $30 deal where you get 1 appetizer, 2 entrees, and 1 dessert! Lovely!

I've been gluten free for about 6 months, and we heard that California Pizza Kitchen had some gluten free options.  Most of what I've had in the way of gluten free pizza has been very disappointing, so my expectations were low.  I'd also never been to a California Pizza Kitchen before. It was awesome!  I had the pepperoni, mushroom, and sausage gluten free pizza, and it was great.  Not just gluten free great, but pizza for real great.  It was so good that we ordered one to go for me to have for dinner. The kitchen manager even came out to explain the gluten free process they use, and the personal touch was appreciated.  When I ordered a gluten free version of a regular pizza, they were very careful to make sure I was aware of possible cross contamination, which doesn't occur for their 4 certified gluten free pizzas. So whether you have a moderate intolerance like I do, or full blown Celiac Disease, they can get you a pizza that tastes like a pizza.

I haven't visited CPK in a while, I was quite happy the group chose to eat there for lunch. We had a server that was a complete air-head imho. Pretty standard routine. Sat down, was greeted, asked for drinks. Ordered two peach lemonades. We got two peach Iced Teas instead. Mistake 1. Whatever, no biggie. She took our order, we asked 1 salad for no dressing, came with bbq sauce. Mistake #2. One other salad with extra dressing on side. Never came. Mistake #3 Asked for the complimentary bread 4 times, spread throughout the meal, we ate for about 45 minutes or so. Never came. Mistake #4 Half-way through, we actually gave up on even asking for things, we knew she would completely forget 20 seconds later anyways... It made the food taste average, Sorry CPK. Train your employees better I Disapprove of the Chino Location!! -Goodfood.LA

I hadn't been to a CPK in years due to one negative experience that changed my view of this establishment, obviously for the long-term worse.  My aunt recently planned her birthday here for a party of 12--basically my immediate relatives.  Upon arriving, they had our table ready. Our server was friendly and accommodating and even shared a joke or two.  We ordered a little bit of everything, with most items falling within the OK category. Although I enjoyed the Chile relleno, I was  bit put off by the chicken that was in the dish. It was the same cubed, boiled (but it looked grilled) previously forzen chicken that was in the pasta dishes, appetizer/ rolls and so on. Not impressed.  Now, the one and only item on their menu that I would recommend to anyone is their butter cake. That's some good cake. It's so simple yet oh so indulgent. This was my visit's one redeeming factor.  I will come back --just for that butter cake.

I came in with my baby few mos ago. Our server named ANGEL was by far the rudest person not just server i've encountered my whole life. I asked for soup of the day, he gave me a smirk and said its the same soup everyday! How was I suppose to know?! So he never answered my questik n, then moved on to offering wine, I said I don't drink cause I just had a baby, again he gave the ugliest annoyed face then said well call me when you're ready to order. I was like Wow! Dont they screen people when they hire them? Worst dining experience!

The artichoke and spinach pizza was delicious, accompanied by a fantastic Italian chopped salad, with CPK's amazing avocado rolls to start.  Thanks to Christina's excellent service, we had a wonderful, romantic anniversary dinner.  We'll be back without a doubt.  And let's not forget their Long Beach Iced Teas, which are perfect!

Boyfriend and I came here for dinner last night. The food and drinks were quite yummy. Especially the spinach & artichoke dip!! No complaints there.  But the service was definitely lacking. Yes it was a busy fri night but hire more waiters/waitresses! They were so understaffed that our section was being taken care of by the bartender. He was very nice yes and tried his best. But he kept running back and forth to tend the bar and our part of the restaurant. Lots of waiting around. Too much.
I thought the bbq chicken pizza was superb and the tortilla soup! Also the service is great! The places decor is quite nice as well!  I hope to try out the other pizzas next time !

Worst service EVER! The moment we walked in we weren't greeted. There was a waiter on the phone, he saw us walk in and turned his back to us. We were seated and the manager took out drink and food order. Then our waitress came and she asked what we wanted to order and we told her we had been helped, after thay she was no longer in sight. I ordered my usual, the italian chopp salad, and it was HORRIBLE. The lettuce was wilted and seemed as if it got too cold so the lettuce was transparent. The tomatoes were so mushy I decided to send it back. I finally flagged down a waitress and complained about my salad and she said she would get our nonexistent waitress. I saw her tell her something was wrong with my salad and the customers she was helping (which were her family members) and her proceeded to look in my direction with snotty looks on their faces. She came to my table and apologized and said shed get me another one but at that point I was over it and wanted to go home. My sister ordered her usual pepperoni pizza and it was oozing with grease. I used to love cpk but now I'm over going here. Service sucks and the food qualities so low.

This CPK wasn't so great and service took forever. The korean pizza was meh. Our server was doing double duty as a bartender and so we rarely saw him. Because of that we had to flag people down for to get drinks refill and took forever to order food/receive food.
Service good but the pizza dough doesn't work when I check in. Be in safer side and just give yr card number.

Lack luster. Slow. Unimpressed. The underwhelming service began right as we entered the door. I host and 3 servers hanging out by the hostess stand. They could not figure out who was next and couldn't remember the names given. So that was an experience just in itself.  I had a seat later facing the hostess stand. It was really unprofessional to watch 5 giggling employees hang out up front and not have much of any service. On to the food.......the food........I swear I ordered food...... Oh you don't know why its taking so long? Me either.  The food took forever and it really should not have based on how full it was. They brought out a second round of complimentary bread to help, but refills on our drinks would have been nice too. (Side note, watched the staff mess up two other tables orders while we waited...did not promote much hope) Once it did arrive, my pepperoni and sausage pizza was WAY over seasoned. My wife ordered her gluten free pizza. It was chewy and was missing sauce on about halve of the pizza. We just asked for our bill, a to go sauce for her and bailed.  As me and wife, we won't be back and from the looks of things around us, I think a few others will surely follow suit.
Went last night for a different taste of pizza. Marghuerita pizza was great!!, and the mango smoothie was awesome!! Good service, but our place on table was dirty, we had to request another.
THE SERVICE IS HORRIBLE HERE!! The 2 stars is for the food, it's pretty tasty. But the bad service makes it not worth setting a foot in the door.

My grandma makes better pizza. Quick, and a decent place to take a girl for dinner (Don't take a girl on a date for pizza) If you want pizza, go to Pieology. Highly recommend the customizaable pizza there.

Had dinner there tonight and it was very busy.  Our server was good and the food came quickly.  In fact, a bit too quickly; the entrees came before the appetizer.  They did bring the entrees later, but we suspect it was the same food reheated.  The pasta was too dry and needed more sauce.  The pizza, 5 Cheese and Tomato, was mediocre (maybe the Gouda ruined it). We will stick with the tostada pizza next time.

Me and my boyfriend came in on valentines day. I WAS loving the special. 2 for 30$ deal! Food was amazing as usual! Adrian was being super helpful. He had so much knowledge about the menu! He was super attentive and just DOPE! Khristy and jonathan and especially adrian were so welcoming and made us feel at home. Were DEFINATLY gonna come back and hoping to see them again! So if you guys are ever coming here ask for adrian khristy pe jonathan! Food was amazing also!

Have been here numerous times and usually get the same thing, chicken Caesar sandwich and is always good.  This time I order a pizza with crispy thin crust.  Pizza came out soggy and edges burnt.  For being called a pizza kitchen, you would think the pizza would be done correctly.  Waitress was super nice so no knock against her.  May or may not come back

I come here all the time and I always leave feeling great. But for some reason, the vibe wasn't there tonight. I guess it started when one of the waiters gave my appetizer to the table behind us. Good thing that table said it wasn't theirs. The waited then walked around, like towards the kitchen area and then came back my table. I feel like the portions of the food has really gotten smaller. My spinach and artichoke dip was a small portion compared to the other times I have had it. And when I asked for bread, there was only 3 very small pieces that felt like bread crumbs to me. I will come back to CPK just for the food, but I don't know how often now.

Been here many times including today. Usually get the Chinese Chicken Salad. Love the dressing!! They brought extra at my request. Waitress was very accommodating and checked back frequently. Restaurant very clean.

The Service: Was great, our server was quick with our drinks and food. The appetizers came out almost immediately. He was very attentive as to keeping our drinks full. He was knowledgeable about suggesting what we should order and what was appropriate for our family style dinner. We ordered:   Avocado Eggroll - great appetizer, crispy shell and a fresh slice of avocado inside. The sriracha cream sauce was on point. Hawaiian Pizza - was doughy and had a very minimal amount of ham and pineapple. Sweet Pear Pizza - the dough was very crisp and thin, the pear was too sweet for my taste. All of the pizza's dough were very inconsistent. Spinach Alfredo - the pasta was a bit over al dente and the sauce was dry. Jambalaya Shrimp Pasta - this was my favorite; the meat/shrimp-to-pasta ratio was incredible. There was heat and spice; very hearty and wholesome.

So a few months ago I got really angry at another CPK location and swore to never come back... but the fiance discovered another CPK gift card, so we decided to check this location. While I still think the prices are still pretty dang high for what you get, we had a MUCH better time at this CPK. Unlike the other location, the food was pretty good and the service was substantially better! I'm losing my mind a bit and can't remember what the fi had, but I ordered the Caramelized Peach Salad and it was seriously DELISH. The peaches were sooo good and I loved that the salad was a deep green with a nice, light vinaigrette, which made me feel at least slightly healthy. Can't say we'll definitely be back, but CPK has been redeemed for me! If we find another gift card, we will definitely be coming to this location.

This place is really good and I think it was the first time I had eaten at one. I went with a friend and their family member. We should the Chips and Spinach Artichoke Dip and the White Pizza. All great. I would the items to be a bit cheaper, but the prices are fair. I like the bread and olive oil as well. I believe it comes free.

Service was horrible!! I came here for my nephews birthday, and everything was great but our waitress. The hosts were nice, the food tasted great, but the waitress was just so horrid.  I sat down and the waitress comes over with ZERO personality and just asks if I know what I want. But the rest of my party isn't there and I haven't even gotten my water yet!  As my party came in we asked the hostess if we could move to an open booth. She said it was okay, and our waitress comes, looks annoyed that we moved, and just asks rudely, "did someone say it was okay for you to move?". The only thing stopping me from telling her off is my nephew.  After taking our order the only time she came by was when she dropped off the check. Definitely never coming back here again if I see her.

I came in to pick up a takeout and got all the food which was salads , pizza , pasta and I had asked for plates. 'The Girl did not pack the food with the plates................. OK next time I will ask for double the amount of plates

Did a take out order. The worker on the phone was polite. Not friendly, but polite, which is never a bad thing. I called about 10 minutes before I was told it was done.  I got to the location between the time I was told (4:50-5 pm), I think at like 4:55. I was informed my pizza was not done yet, so I did all the transaction stuff. But it they were still slow. The cashier, Janey, was really nice, but that can't make up for slow service.  Only issue I would complain bout is at the fact that they told me it would be done between 4:50-5 pm, and I didn't leave till 10 minutes later. I don't mind waiting, I understand you have to make my food, but give me an accurate time at least. If I called only 10 min before it should be done, I feel like you should have a good idea how busy you are and the time it'll be done. I donn want to wait in my blazing hot car longer than necessary.
Great drinks, food, and service!  Jessica C. is such a sweetheart, is very attentive, and always recommends the best pairings of food and wine!

I've only ordered take-out from this location, and for that, this location has never disappointed me. All CPKs have a take-out curbside service, but the one time I actually used it, I waited more than 10 minutes sitting in my car, in the hot, hot heat, waiting for my food; so I definitely do recommend just going down and picking up your order yourself. My usual order from this location was always the Garlic Cream Penne with added diced tomatoes. All CPKs serve free bread and olive oil, however, for some strange reason, the bread and olive oil here tastes 5x better than any other location I've been to. Not a bad place to grab lunch!

I like this place the food is good and the staff has always been friendly. I mainly come here when my truck is across the street getting washed so I can have a drink while I wait but occasionally I come for dinner and I have to say the eggs rolls are delicious and I love the tortilla soup. I enjoy coming to CPK during the week because it's relatively quite and I can actually relax and unwind from a stressful day of work.
All CPK are the same to me. Prices definitely does not meet the quantity nor the quality of the food. This place is overrated and overpriced. Recommend this place for all the rich people only.

Just went here for lunch. The server was great everything was good except the food was terrible. We both ordered the Chinese chicken salad and it was bland and wilted. Then they took it back and we ordered the chicken dumplings. They were cold and the filling was terrible. I like CPKs pizza but won't order anything else at this restaurant.

IDk what the heck it is but I came back and gave this place another chance. I still enjoy their tortilla soup but they are realy cutting back on their portions and quality. My grilled chicken caesar salad used to be quite beautiful and filling but now I look inside of it to find 1 smal piece of chicken cut up into pieces. They used to use large pieces of romaine but now they just use the pre cut romaine that fall out of the sandwich whenever I bite into it. Also I don't know what it is but the past 2 times I've come here I got sick afterwards..I think its their AC that is on high even when it is cold outside. I woke up with a sore throat on both mornings after I visited for dinner the night before. I've learned my lesson and won't be back to this location.

Horrible customer service!! Sat and waited for 15 minutes without a waiter taking our order-not even our drink order. They seated another group-took their order right away. We walked out. Have never had to do that before. It was just RIDICULOUS.

Pizza, Chicken Tequila Lime Fettuccini, bread, beer, and some nice televisions, well can't get better than this. Oh yes excellent service and always with a smile. That is what you get at the CPK in Chino Hills. Love Coming here for some good pizza and pasta. Even late in the evening they still treat you great and make you feel welcome.

I actually really like the food from CPK. But the service will never make me eat there again. At least not this one in Chino Hills. Service is crap. Good food but service is crap. My mom got so pissed off we couldn't even finish out lunch. Don't want to mention any names . But the girl who served us was rude, sarcastic , and beyond unacceptable . Ordered a salad. She dropped it off and just walked away.. waited for her to come back with plates so we could share..  IS THAT SO MUCH TO ASK FOR? she pointed out that we already had a plate.. OK? well can I have another one? came back and slammed it on the table.  AND THEN.. it just kept getting worse.. to the point that everything that came out of her mouth was disrespectful. Manager was no help... Just thinking about this pisses me off.

Had a GREAT meal and GREAT service. Our favorite register gal from Corner Bakery was our waitress now at CA Pizza Kitchen and she did a great job. We had the new roasted veggie salad and pear Gorgonzola pizza and it was perfect! The salad has perfectly roasted veggie and the dressing is just right. Maybe a dressing on the side next time but we didn't care for tonight because it was our splurge meal.  we love this place and are grateful it is i our city!

I am just leaving CPK. Overall the service was okay, she was nice and polite. The second star is only because of an amazing Lime Agave Margarita we ordered.  My family's food was about average... there was nothing remarkably special about it.  Now my main issue was with my Chicken Cobb salad. I just couldn't get passed the texture of the "chicken" it was simply inedible. It had an almost gelatin-likw consistency. Have watched the show Everybody Loves Raymond where Ray's mom makes a tofu turkey for Thanksgiving that giggles? Well folks that was my chicken!!! I could bend it in half and did so directly in front of my waitress who seemed grossed out. So now that I re-lived my tofurky/chicken experience im kinda aggravated. I ordered a to-go  meal for my Dad (wish me luck). P.S. To my server: if you see that my chicken bends in half and the rest of my family is done with their meal just take the stupid half salad off of my tab. It will increase the likelihood of me coming back. Changed my mind because im aggravated... 1 star for you!

I had a great first experience here at cpk!!! We had a big party with us for a birthday party. The waitress and staff were super nice and helpful... I Would definitely like to go back soon... I had the bbq chicken pizza and is was delicious!! I also ordered the Mac n cheese on the kids menu for my son, and that was also great!! I am Very pleased and will definitely be back

The food was not bad. we ordered 1/2 order of a salad and a pizza 1/2 pepperoni 1/2 thai chicken and waters. The bill was $28 and change. We felt this was a bit expensive for what we got. Overall, too expensive for what we got. Service was acceptable.
Fish tacos were not impressive. Pizza size was said to be 12" but came out to 9". Good salads.

I wish I could leave Minus 5 star for this location. The worst pizza I have ever had along with horrible service. The take out order was delayed for over 10 minutes. They forgot bread, napkin and utensil. The worst part is the pizza itself was not even warm, taste like the leftover from yesterday!!! The sausage was over cooked like the charcoal. Cheese is so little like no cheese. My experience was so bad that I felt I had to write first review with Yelp to let go my feelings.

I feel as if it is very overpriced for what you get...I got the Cobb salad, half order and it was over $10 and it looked like a side salad...was very disappointed...but I do love the pizza's you have to try the California club pizza...and that's all I have to say about that...

This location is such a disappointment. I'm usually pretty content with eating at CPK - the menu is simple enough and there's a wide variety of options to choose from but this location is a total letdown. First off I came here with my boyfriend on a rainy Saturday afternoon before we went to watch a movie for a late lunch, around 1:30 PM. They seated us quickly but our waiter/waitress never appeared. Finally after seeing the hostesses gather around awkwardly at the front looking at our table, they sent a hostess up to bring some drinks out for us. 10 minutes later, our one-hit wonder waitress appeared asking if we wanted some bread while we wait for our food after taking our order. We said sure and patiently waited for the bread... but it never came and she never appeared again. Service was terrible for the remainder of the lunch - no one came and offered a refill for drinks and it was a hassle to get the check and change.   Food was pretty average - we ordered the ravioli and the bbq chicken pizza- I'd say that's where the majority of these stars go.  Sorry CPK - this one's a disappointment. I think I'd rather go eat at any of the other restaurants in this plaza instead of this one another time.

For a chain CPK is one of the better ones, but still not really stand out. I was obsessed with their roasted veggie pizza, but they no longer carry it. The salads are good, but far from healthy, pizzas are good but kind of on the small side and I always get their egg rolls. Service is ok, a bit slow and prices a bit higher than they need to be for chain food. Wouldn't go out of my way to come back, but it was fine.
This place is great not just for their pizza, but they also have great entree salads and more. Very casual atmosphere with a full bar. They also have outside seating.

My husband,friend, baby and I went to the Chino location on a Sunday and we were very satisfied both with the food and the service. We didn't wait long before we were seated. I had the Garlic Cream Fettuccine and it was delicious. I also tried the Pesto Creme and it was also good. Our waitress was absolutely great! She was very attentive by bringing milk to my baby and her suggestions were useful. We payed a total of $49 for three meals plus drinks, pretty good!
Pizza was pretty good. Wasn't a fan of the overall appearance and is rather pricey. I feel that I've had better tasting pizza appearance and taste wise for a bigger portion and cheaper price.

I have to say that the service Jonathan deserves five stars!! He is patient and smiling even when he had to take orders from undecided kids. We have always been to CPK for the creamy garlic fettuccine with shrimp. Shrimp there is succulent and fresh. Their spinach and artichoke pizza is also awesome.
CPK's curbside service is wonderful!! It makes it so easy to pick up take out even when I am not feeling that well!!

I have never been disappointed here. I try something new everytime I come, and it's so good. The food is unique and delicious, and the drinks are varied enough to satisfy any craving. I came here with my best friend recently -- she had cranberry vodka, and I had Guinness. They also do to-go -- my friend and I ordered a medium pizza once and took it to English Springs Park.
Food is good but the service was really bad. They forgot our pizza order and we had to wait and wait.

The service was mostly good, except that one lapse where our server disappeared for like 5 minutes before ordering...Servers be cute doe.   This place is overpriced. I hate to base a review on price, but when Pieology (~$9) is 1 mile away, and Pizza Hut (~$13)  is across the street, c'mon... $15 for a pizza!? That being said, the pizza is pretty good quality. I've never been to a CPK before. The pizzas are not greasy, which is a huge plus (Unlike Pizza Hut). Their barbecue sauce is also a supporting flavor, which is rare because usually, barbecue IS the flavor. CPK does this pretty well. I also enjoyed the fresh feeling of eating pineapple with pizza. That's more of a personal thing.  There's just better alternatives in the exact same area, so I can't justify this price at all. But when all's said and done, it fed 2. But at what price? Oh right, $15.

I got the asparagus and spinach fettuccini with shrimps (~$17). The shrimps and pasta were not overcooked. The flavor was not overpowering but still flavorful. My friend got the pesto fettuccini (~12). That was also good. It was creamy but I think I would have liked it with more pesto. Another friend got the jambalaya fettuccini (~17). I thought it was a little bland and should have been more spicy. Bread was served before our meals and it was fresh. Instead of balsamic vinegar and oil, it was served with herbs and oil, which provided a nice fragrance with every bite. Overall, the food and service were good and I had a great time.

SWEET STAFF & PIZZA We came for my moms birthday and our server was so attentive and incredibly sweet I just HAD to write a yelp review!  Here's what to order: Lettuce wrap: ground chicken and yummy sweet sauce. This is a winner! They never give enough lettuce but fret not because they're happy to give you more! Avocado egg rolls: if you love fried things get this! Comes with a ranch and a chipotle sauce. Yummy but my fav is the ones at BJ's.  Waldorf Salad: my fav here comes with sliced grapes (purple ones), apples, candied walnuts, celery and lovely greens in a delicious dressing. Sweeter side but refreshing! I don't like blue cheese so I opted out.  Kung spaghetti: bombdotcom! I like it with chicken but shrimp is good too. Noodles are al dente and it's slightly sweet with a spicy kick! Don't eat the red peppers whatever you do it you will pay for it later!  I love CPK and the chino hills location is clean, organized and friendly!
Love this CPK! Waiters/waitresses are always helpful. Love to get those dough points too. I always like going when Brit is there too because she's so nice, friendly, and attentive.

The service is good but I was highly disappointed because they changed there signature BBQ chicken pizza. It tastes different and has very little chicken on it, but it still has the same high price.  My kids had pasta dishes and they said they were good so I guess they can still do something's right.

I'm not quite sure what everyone else was talking about but my service was quite attentive.  monday afternoon and there was a moderate amount of people there.... anyway. bred came with olive oil sprinkled with dry herbs. as good as bread is.  chicken tequila fettuccine $15ish. an oldtime favorite of mine.  was as good as i remembered it and as small as i remembered it.  meh. wish it was a bigger portion. Pear Gorgonzola pizza.  another favorite of mine.  Very good. very worth it.  something about the pears, carmelized onions, goat? feta? cheese and field greens just makes it delicious... my first fancyish mixed drink!  "Top shelf" long island iced tea.  I think 2 parts kettle one vodka, 1 part beefeater gin, 1 part cointrearu, 1 part bacardi supperior? topped with simple syrup? and coke.  was pretty good... very alcoholic.  not quite sure what other yelpers have said about under pouring.  I think each part was 3/4 of an ounce.  anywho. service was alright.  refills on water took some time but other than that everything was good.

Enjoy the atmosphere and delicious food. Had an incident with customer service and General Manager Stephen Niemela was right on point when handling the incident. No hassles, he addressed the incident and apologized and offered outstanding customer service. Was a pleasure to deal with. Will continue to enjoy and recommend CPK Chino Hills as always.

Took the family here on a Friday night around 9 pm. Hannah was are server, she provided excellent customer service. She was friendly and kept our glasses/ bread basket full. The food was delicious and served hot, but took 47 minutes to come starting at the time our order was placed.

Very nice customer service!   From the moment we walked in til the moment we left!  Hostess was soooo sweet making small talk and excellent personality.   Waitress so right on point. She explained the whoooole menu and drink menu too.  They give you a complementary guac for being a 1st time customer.  I am very very impressed with the service! Best service evaaa hands down...  I will be back fo'sho.

I'm here with friends after the bubble run, and we're thirsty and hungry to the max :). But they understood that and welcomed us with a nice "hello bubble runner!" Although there were a lot of people, we had really good server (buzz cut dude). Overall good ambiance and feel!

This is now our CPK of choice. Great good, excellent services. We tried some of the new menu items. I got the arugula quinoa salad with grilled shrimp and it was delicious! I also tried the blueberry smash cocktail. Which by the picture looks light and refreshing, I didn't reading the menu! It was a rum and whiskey drink and boy it was strong!

I do love this location. Twice now, no waiting for tables, even on Mother's Day. The staff is friendly and the food is delicious. During both of my visits, the free bread with the oil dip took a long time to get to us, even after we informed the waitress that we were starving. Additionally, there were five of us at the table, so four pieces of bread is not going to work, basic math. I would still eat there. I just have to be patient, I guess.

The only reason I'm giving 5 stars is because my server Jahzeel was so extraordinary that I had to give some feedback. She was running around helping about 5-6 other tables while still being rather attentive to my table. She also had great suggestions as to what I should order and even went so far as to ask how my day was going (what a sweetheart). I will only be back if I could get the same top notch service I had on his occasion. Thank you.
There gluten free barbecue chicken pizza is really good and doesn't have the nasty gluten free crust a lot of restaurants have. I ordered take out and it came out quickly.

I ordered their Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage pizza.  My order came out about 20 minutes later, and THAT'S when our server told me they ran out of mushrooms! Okkkk??? Could she not have told me that BEFORE she brought out my cooked pizza without the mushrooms??? I would have ordered something else then. ... But I wasn't even offered the options to change my order! Um, the first word in what I ordered is Mushroom. I would think thats a pretty important ingredient in the dish.  Oh... And then she said, they had mushrooms, but they would take 30 minutes to cook. What?! Mushrooms?! They don't take THAT long to cook... And i'll be done eating by then! So, needless to say, i was disappointed. I never even got my mushrooms, even after the 30 minutes had passed. My pizza wasn't even anywhere near what it looked like in the picture they had on their menu. That picture was deceiving. It looked more like a cheese pizza with a few slices of pepperoni and a few slices of sausage. Idk if i'll be back. They may not have exactly what i order from the menu. Or they may bring it out to me with some missing important ingredients, and not give me an option to change my mind

Great service, not so great food! We ordered a small plate, Halibut ( fish ) , pizza and chicken lettuce wraps.All of them lacked flavor and taste.We had to return the fish, it was absolutely tasteless! .The manager on duty was pleasant enough to take it off the bill and actually come over and ask why we did not like the fish and what they could do to make it better. Thumbs up on the service, eh on the food!
Checking out the remodel and the place is brighter  We stuck to our usual fare but the new menu items do look good

This location has great service and quality food. We've been here quite a few times and have never been disappointed. The view outside is nice and, when the weather's right, you can sit outside and enjoy a relaxing lunch or dinner.

Amazing customer service!  I ordered for to go and got there at the time my order was set to be ready for pick up. Everything was ready to go, packaged, and just being kept warm. They didn't start when I got there, but actually ready when it should be unlike other to go places. I love that they have a separate take out counter.  No complaints. Everything was packaged perfectly, even the drinks.  Shout out to Kaytie for being awesome!

Amazing service! Our waitress we so attentive and made sure to check in on us to ensure that we were enjoying our meal!  Considering it was a Friday night the wait wasn't long for a table. Our appetizers came out quickly and just as we finished our entrees were being brought out! Definitely going to come back to this CPK again!!

I must say that this location has Superb servers. Brittany, and Brandy in particular. Not only are they very informed on the menu and changes happening in the store, they are attentive, and they are professional.  I'd come for the service alone but the food is amazing! The tostada pizza is to die for. The crust is flaky and delicious. Everything tastes fresh. food comes out fast, cocktails are fantastic and the portions are big enough to share.

The CPK in Brea is DEFINITELY better. The space here and the food here are pretty great. The tables are a little small and the portions are smaller than Brea portions for sure. With the price, it's just not worth it. Our server Randy was MIA most of the time. He brought our starter breads after our entrees and appetizers were served.  Food was great tho: -Appetizers: Shrimp Lettuce Wrap, Mushroom & Spinach Flatbread  -Lunch Duo was a really great deal  -BBQ Chicken Pizza was pretty dope  -Thai Chicken Salad is always the best
The service here was wonderful. The food and the drink was so good. I love this place!

CPK is one of my favorite restaurants but I must say I was disappointed with this location! My fiancé and I waited 20min to be asked what we would like to drink when about 4 servers passed by and took the others of others around us. What's more disappointing is that it wasn't a busy night. A young man by the name of Adrian ended up helping us and he wasn't even a server but did a great job, he kept apologizing and states he couldn't find our server. Tried his best to bring us our food and drinks as soon as he could and checked up on us every second he could. He is the only reason I am giving this place a start!
Bad food this time around. Everything came out burned. They replaced it with more burned food.  Was just not enjoyable. Your demise hurts me, CPK. It hurts.... However, the service was outstanding.

Always experience long waits for the food to arrive.  Servers are nice, the food is good, but to wait 25 minutes for kids Mac n Cheese and a salad is ridiculous.  Especially since the restaurant was not packed.

CPK is definitely one of my favorite restaurants.I like their Hawaiian and American Club pizzas are my favorite.Their shrimp pasta has a small portion,but tastes wonderful.However,the wait is dreadfully long.If you plan to eat there,you may plan to say for two hours or more.It takes a long time for them to even refill the drinks,and sometimes the waiters and waitresses ignore you.The baked potato soup tastes good,except for the stuff they add inside.The kid's sundae has a good price,only $1.

Yummy pizza, Ceaser salad and drinks. Nice staff. Food runner forgot to bring us extra dressing we requested, but our server (Bee) got it ASAP. Always a good spot for a quick bite to eat!  Had a new drink....coconut blossom. Like a piña colada on the rocks. Yummy!! Even got a little buzz off it!! I'm sure we will be back!!

Wow, really disappointed. New look but their food has taken a turn for the worse. Very chintzy  on the chicken in their pasta dishes and all our wine glasses were dirty. Our server was okay and he let the manager know we were unsatisfied but she never bothered to stop by. Pretty bummed because this use to be one our our regular spots....not any more!

Excellent all around! Excellent service, excellent food, fresh, great atmosphere. Im picky and have been to a lot of good places, so this gets 5 stars!  Avoid the Riverside location at all costs! You'll get terrible everything there.
Food was great and the service was better! Best praise I can possibly give to be honest. Usually it's just one or the other. Give this location a try if you're in the area

We always have such a nice experience at this location! Service is always friendly, and we have never had an issue with our food! Because of the layout the restaurant can be a little loud, and at times it can be hard to hear your company at the table.  We recommend the mushroom pizza and the Thai crunch salad! The mushroom pizza is super savory and loaded with different kinds of mushroom! The Thai crunch salad is addictive. Creamy peanut dressing, edamame beans, juicy chicken, and crunch wontons & peanuts. A full size salad is extremely easy to share! Also, they make a very flavorful key lime pie and tiramisu for dessert. We order one Togo if we fill up on dinner. Both are delicious! Take advantage of their gift card specials around the holidays! They usually offer some sort of kickback special when you purchase, which we tuck away for a later date for a spontaneous dinner! We love this location! Great job!

First time customer here. Host didnt bother asking or promoting their most requested meals etc. Appetizer bread with the side of oil is not very tasty. Too oily & bread is too hard. We sat at our table for about 30mins after we ordered & no sign of our server to check up on us or keep us posted. But, once we got our meals (WHICH WERE DELISH) our server stopped by our table an exaggerated amount of times. Kind of annoying. Specially when you're food arrive a few secs after you just got it & im goin in for the 1st bite. Other than that, place is clean and food is a 5 STARS. I will go again on a slower day.
the bbq chicken pizza is delicious pizza, especially with the applewood bacon and pineapple. the staff is friendly and down to earth! only the price for the size of pizza can be better.

The service is fast the staff are nice place has great ac. Parking can be a bit tricky but I got lucky and parked in front. Yessss Food was delicious like always and the ice tea was great.  No complaints

One of the better CPKs in the area! Haven't been to CPK in years, but decided to try it out Wednesday night. No wait at all and we were greeted by a friendly hostess and promptly seated.  We were asked by the hostess if it was our first time here. Our waitress was so friendly and helpful.  She also asked us if it was our first time here. After we put in our drink order (try the agave mojito!), the manager brought us the Bianco flatbread and said it was on the house and to welcome us to this CPK!! In the past, I remember CPKs bread being lackluster and served with cubes of butter.  Not anymore!  The bread was crispy with a soft center and served with yummy olive oil! We also ordered the tortilla soup, BBQ chicken salad and tostada crispy thin crust pizza.  Both were pretty good, not bad, but nothing spectacular either. The reason for 4 stars is the price; a tad pricey in my opinion, which I realize is not this particular location's fault.  Otherwise, the service gets 5+ stars!!

This was our first time at a California Pizza Kitchen. The staff was very polite.  The manager Brittany very good,  professional.  Server Vanessa was awesome,  kept up with our drinks and clearing the table.  Adrian is a great server too. Plenty of smiles and the food was great.  We will be back.

The lovely couple came in pretty late for dinner. Mrs started with the farmer's market soup and Mr had the tortilla soup. According to them, the Farmer's market soup was nice. A bit too thick likely from being held on simmer for sometime. The tortilla soup was pretty thick too and it needs a bit of rehab. This was the favorite soup from back in the early 90s, along with the potato leek soup. Two in a bowl: Sedona white corn tortilla/Potato Leek Soup-- was the best!  Seems like the tortilla soup has just deteriorated over the years. Too bad.  The soup was followed by an order of Chicken Milanese. Nice!  Never fails to satisfy.   There was a marked difference on service and attentiveness of the staff.  The couple noted that the service they received was great!  Their attentive server who was really engaging and pretty, made sure they had a great dining experience.  The other servers didn't seem to mind helping other customers too.  That's really good.

We ordered take out using the menu online and the person on the phone repeated our order. When we went to pick up the order a few of the items were no longer offered and instead of calling us they substituted the items with other dishes. When we questioned it the employee responded in such an apathetic way. The experience left a negative feeling for us with such poor customer service.

Man! The service here on a Saturday sucks!!! Our waitress was more concerned with sitting at her friends booth and çhatting than doing her job. We had to flag other waitresses to get refills and get napkins.

Very disappointed by what happened today, being my family eats here probably more than half the week...  SERVICE - was so bad, not only did they forget about the bread several times... But when it came to the actual meal, which was a "Chicken Tostada Pizza" there was no chicken... The best part was they tried charging us extra for offering me a side of chicken, when I should have had chicken on the pizza in the first place. You guys may have lost our business...

One of our office locations is in Chino Hills and my uncle lives in Chino Hills as well, hence I have been to this location several times with my coworkers and family. It is located in the Chino Shoppes Mall and it is walking distance from Dripp and Dolicissimo [dessert/coffee afterwards?]. Every time I have been here I have circled at least 2-3 times in the parking lot to find parking. Service here is great, I have been here in small group as well big group of people. They are very attentive either way.  Few of my favorite items from this restaurant: - Avocado Club Egg Rolls : It has that perfect crispness outside and then the soft texture of avocado inside. I have attempted making that few times at home but have failed miserably and after that I would just go the CPK and have a plate to myself [to make myself feel better]. - Spinack Artichoke Dip: I feel like that is everyone's go-to plate! The creaminess of the dip is just amazing. - Thai Crunch Salad: I have had this once just because the picture looked appealing but to be honest I like their pizzas better than salads. - Spicy Chipotle Chicken: Probably my favorite because it has corn [which I love] and its has that spicy kick to it! I have tried it without chicken. - Roasted Garlic Chicken: I have tried it without chicken, but then again one can never go wrong with garlic! There is no such thing as too much garlic - okay maybe there is... - Tostada Pizza: I feel like it is their signature dish. I like the mixture of crunchiness from the tortilla chips.  - Roasted Artichoke + Spinach: Try it with their hot salsa. My coworker loves coming here because they have gluten free options! It just makes her happy to see that she can still have a meal with her coworkers or her family without going to special gluten free restaurant.  P.S. Two Thumbs up for their Strawberry Mango Cooler!

With all the locations I've been to, CPK has never failed me until this one. I was disappointed with a lot about this location. Service was horribly slow and some pieces in my pasta were cold. The salad basically had no dressing on it (really, it was pretty much dry).  Also, I've never been to a CPK with TVs. I think it's a shame considering this is typically a nice restaurant good for dates and getting away from the tv and that sort of thing. This place had a lot of tvs which in my opinion is a downside.

Really nice customer service, and welcoming. Our fav is usually the bbq chicken pizza and the mushroom pizza! Both really good. Today we tried.. -spicy quesadilla... Really good -guacamole w/ sweet corn.. Really good -Cesar Salad... Super bland -Tortilla soup.. Too thick, wasn't that great! -Strawberry lemonade... They used pink dye.. Mad me really sad lol
Best pizza ever, also love all their salads. The service is always great and the atmosphere has good energy. This is one of our families favorite restaurants.
Food was pretty bland. Thought it was just me being sick so I had my friend try my food and she had the same feedback. This is a resto chain, shouldn't the taste be consistent with other locations?

Came here with a large group for my birthday and everything turned out great. I'm glad I chose this place. Everyone loved their dishes and our service was good. Very clean location as well! I really like it here.

This was me and my boyfriends first time visiting any CPK, and when we mentioned it to the host they made sure to make it memorable! Our waiter, Adrian, was very nice and talked us through whatever we didn't know and was there when we needed him. The food was delicious! I ordered the chicken milanese, and it was delicious, especially when you squeeze the lemon juice on top. My boyfriend ordered the seasonal pizza that had egg and bacon on top, and it was like breakfast on pizza, very different from any other pizza we have had.  Overall the service was wonderful, food delicious, and a very nice establishment.

I've been to a few locations and have had good experiences  but this one was disappointing today. Took my Mom for a late lunch and we ordered a appetizer which was their hummus plate. It took almost 15 minutes to arrive and tasted like sand and quickly thrown together. We asked to change it which was done. We ordered a simple salad and salmon plate which took another 20 minutes. The waitress said that's normal which was never the case before. The restaurant was dead so no excuse. The manager came by and didn't offer anything to compensate for the long waits and poorly made appetizer. Would not recommend this location.

CPK is an old reliable spot. The service at this location was absolutely top notch. Our server anticipated just about every need (super important when you've got a gaggle of children with you.) At one point, our middle child changed her mind about her pizza, and our server didn't even blink an eye. She brought out a replacement macaroni and cheese.  The Blueberry Smash is a must, as well.  Parking is a bit tough (this is a busy plaza). I parked on the P.F. Chang side and got a convenient spot.

What a great post Spartan Race victory meal with my mom. Service here at CPK today was exceptional. Our server Emily was super attentive, genuine and kind. The store manager Anna welcomed us with a complimentary flat bread since it was my moms first visit. Couldn't have asked for a better experience. Oh, and the food was awesome! :)  Thank You CPK Chino Hills! Aroo...!

We frequent this place almost every Friday. It's my daughters favorite place to eat. I usually have something small but coming here after work is actually relaxing for me. The food is good. I enjoy the harvest soup and of course the bread

It's been years since we tried CPK and now I remember why.  We were given Gift cards or we wouldn't have come here.  Ist off,  I am handicapped and the parking is in the rear, and It's a long walk (for me anyway) to the front door.  They only have a limited number of HC Parking but we were fortunate someone was leaving just as we got there or we would have had to walk even further.  So we were greeted nicely by the "door ladies"?  lol and seated in a booth under air conditioning and were freezing as it was January 16th my wife's Birthday.  We ordered and waited and waited.  They finally brought my wife her entree before her soup and salad and appetizer and I had to wait until she was almost done to get my food.  Her's and mine were cold by the time it got there.  The restaurant was not that busy yet we had to ask 3 people for water.  bye the time  it arrived by some other waiter, our waiter brought hers.  I ordered a pizza and before the waiter left my wife said.  Make sure its a deep dish as she knows what i prefer. The waiter said..Boy I'm Glad you told me that cause I was just going to put flat pizza.  Well guess what...when i got it..flat as a piece of paper. Tasteless and Cold to the touch.  Needless to say we will not be coming back Edd & Diane Bean
Great place....good service! Love their Pasta! Their butter cake with vanilla bean ice cream is something you have to try!

One of the pizza came out cold, but my family wont let me mention it to the waitress. They felt bad, but i really thought i should have said something. Overall, food is still good, just need the pizza to be hot.
I enjoy CPK. But it's not the best pizza ever by any means. The service at this location was pretty good.

Came in for lunch with my little family today. Jessica was our server and she was amazing, so attentive we never even had to ask for a refill our orders came in quick and everything tasted so delicious!  By far one of the best CPK's we have been too! Thanks Jessica!! Definitely coming back.

Enjoyed the Thai chicken pizza.  The pizza was hot and fresh with right amount of seasoning on the pizza sauce.  The crust was thin and crispy.  Also, had a Blue Moon beer with my pizza.  Everything was perfect expect for the waitress.  The negative was the service. The service was mediocre at the best.  Waiting awhile just to get the rolls to be served.
We had the works pizza and Thai salad and the food was excellent and the service was great. Recommended for sure!!!

So I went here last night for my birthday dinner, and it was pretty good, although I have a few complaints. I really enjoyed the water, the ratio of water to ice was spot on. The complimentary bread with herb-laced oil was delicious as always.  We also ordered the avocado egg rolls as an appetizer and those were amazing for those who enjoy avocado. However, the waitress took forever to clear our appetizer plates once we were finished, and that made the table feel crowded...super annoying.   For my entree, I had the wild mushroom pizza with white truffle oil, which was very savory and yummy, but not as hot as I would like. Additionally, our table was long and vertical rather than circular, which was not conducive to group conversation.  Because it was my birthday, the waitress brought me a hot fudge sundae. That totally rocked my evening, because the hot fudge solidified in the ice cream. Overall, I had a pleasant experience, and I wouldn't hesitate to return!

Cpk is cockroach infested!  one walked from under our table had straight to my friends bread. Waiter went to get the manager while another waiter took the plate away. The manager offered another table, yah right! We left and saw another cockroach walking away from the restauranti

I've been to this location dozens of times, and it never disappoints! They've done some remodeling here and there and I love the way the interior looks now! The staff is also very friendly and helpful, they are so great with checking up on their guests after they receive their food. Also, restrooms are clean, yay!! I normally get the pesto cream penne which even tastes good when I warm the leftovers at home! This is going to be a really short review if I leave it at that, so I'll mention some other items that I've ordered on multiple occasions. The Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese small plate is delicious, I just wish it came with more!!! Alas, that must be why it's called a "small plate." The Spinach Artichoke Dip is a must try, CPK classic. Try the California Club pizza if you're looking for something out of the ordinary, And lastly, the Spicy Chipotle Chicken pizza is enough to satisfy me no matter what I'm craving!

We have been here a number of times and it is not one of the best CPKs. Service is slow and they get the order wrong or forget it all together. Not sure why we keep giving them more chances. Brea CPK is far better.

I'm a lover of CPK but this location sadly disappointed me. My daughter and I decided to dine in last night after the mall closed. We sat down just before 10pm, they're still open for another hour, all good. My waitress seemed like she was in a hurry. No appetizer options, no offer for bread at the table, just, "are you ready to order?" We took a few more minutes to look over the menu; I wanted to try something different than my usual. I asked the waitress for bread for the table. She declined saying that the kitchen wasn't making anymore...but you don't close for another hour? She replied that she didn't know why and went on her way.  My daughter gets her pizza and I get my Caesar salad with added salmon...only instead of the chunks of meat that I'm accustomed to getting I received these 9 small dry pieces (slivers is a more appropriate word) of salmon on top of a huge mountain of lettuce. My daughter and I laughed at it, it looked really absurd. I was disappointed with my meal. I told the waitress and she casually apologized for the lackluster portion... that was it. We finished our meal. I wanted butter cake but the waitress brought the bill without even asking about dessert. After running my card and dropping off the receipts she came back several minutes later to pick up the check before I had a chance to fill it out. I'm assuming she was in a hurry to get off. Attentive but mediocre service. Mediocre meal. I dine at CPK regularly and I was sadly disappointed with my first visit to this location.

Great atmosphere, service was pretty nice and friendly, but they were in a hurry. They didn't offer any appetizers or bread which really was unfortunate cause their bread is probably one of my favorite things about cpk. And when we asked for it, they said they weren't making anymore- even though they weren't closing for another hour.  I got the Jamaican Jerk Pizza and it was amazing and my mom got the salmon salad. Pretty good as well but she didn't like the portion size of the salmon for 4.50$ And thee wasn't much flavor, it was pretty bland. I love Cpk but this location wasn't as great as it could be :/

I would give this place more than five stars if I could. When we sat down, within ten minutes we got our small plate and free bread. After finishing those, we waited about 15-20 minutes for the main course to come out before we asked our server if he could check on our food. Turns out that there was some kind of issue with putting in our order, and the manager gave us our whole meal on the house for the long wait! Our server even offered us free soup while we waited again for the course (although we declined). I mean that's the first time a restaurant has ever been that nice to my family. When the food finally came out, everything was delicious like usual. I love this place even more now, and I'll definitely keep coming back.
Wow! This place is awesome! Everyone is so nice and welcoming the food was good and our waitress Monique was so sweet and always checked on us. I will definitely be coming back

This review is only for Take Out. Ordering on the phone was quick and easy and I was able to pick up my order within 15 minutes. Evrything I ordered was right and the staff was very friendly. I highly recommend.

Came here to shop (something i don't do on a regular basis) and i was hungry and feeling pizza, saw CPK so why not. I've heard about it but never been to one. Got the works pizza with thin crust since i'm not a thick pizza dough person. Pizza was delicious. I didn't know what to expect with the thin crust but it wasn't too thin and not overly greasy. Ingredients were fresh. Definitely not frozen pizza. Place is divided into two sections. Thank god this specific location has drive-thru because i was not feeling the crowd (i also don't do crowds but that's a story for never). Got my pizza in no time than got the F out. Plaza itself was packed. Busy weekend.

Today was my first time here and service is AMAZING! The person who greeted us and sat us down was so friendly and all smiles. Also Jamie who was out waitress was so sweet. And made sure we were satisfied with everything. Drink refills, napkins, taste of food, service etcetera. If I'm ever in the area, I'd definitely eat here again. Thank you staff for the great service! :)

This location is a popular spot for me and my family but recently the service has gone downhill. When our table was seated, no one came by to ask us if we wanted anything to drink, appetizers, etc. We had to hail down our server who took our order with a rushed attitude; she spoke so fast none of us could understand her. During our meal, all of our glasses were empty and our server was nowhere to be seen! I could understand her lack of customer service if it was extremely busy but the restaurant was around 60% full with an appropriate number of staff. Thankfully the food was still good. This restaurant needs some serious work with their staff! Our server's terrible attitude created such a terrible dining experience.
Best CPK I've ever been to. Great food, awesome service, got seated when we first went in, everything. I even got free dessert on my birthday month. Definitely coming back there again!!!

First time visiting a California Pizza Kitchen restaurant were new to the area and I will say this the food was incredible but the service we had was phenomenal Marissa our server was excellent great recommendations and friendly service we will he returning. Thank you !!!

The food here is always fresh, I never feel guilty when I eat here because I know that the ingredients are good quality. The service is always great. I love bringing my family here so that we can all enjoy some good food and have a nice conversation.  The side salads are big, sometimes I split a pizza and a side salad with another person. The shrimp pasta with zucchini is one of my favorites because its not loaded with pasta and I dont feel heavy after eating the whole thing. Overall good place to go.

This is one of our favorite restaurants. My go-to meal is the grilled vegetable salad with salmon. Delicious!  The staff is great and so friendly; however, we've haven't seen many of our favorite servers lately. Does anyone know what happened?

When I came to eat here 2 weeks ago, the service was quite possibly the worst. There were 5 waitresses and maybe 10 tables that were filled, yet service was crazy slow. We could not find our server the majority of the time we were in there (we couldn't ask for cream for the coffee and it ended up getting cold by the time she got to us, she also didn't check in on us to see if we needed anything else after we got the food). Maybe it was just that she was busy, but again, there weren't that many tables that were filled. The food of course was similar to all other CPKs so this rating is just for the service here.

This was our first time at this location and our server, Marissa Anne, was AWESOME! Food was good but this review is about the service provided to us by Marissa. She was very professional and super friendly, always checking in on us. You may think doesn't all the servers do that...probably, but Marissa puts an extra comfort into the visit. We will be back!!

This place is amazing. My girl and I went a couple weeks ago on a Friday night and I believe our server was Adrian. Great dude and awesome customer service. Not only that but it was my first time there and I think the manager brought us a complimentary appetizer. The food was amazing too. I will definitely be back!
Great service. Nice staff. We came here with a party of 7 for drinks around 9:30 on a Saturday. We were seated outside immediately, just for drinks. No issues. Thanks Pizza kitchen!

We like that they're kid friendly; even opened the front door for us & our gigantic clumsy stroller, lol. Super friendly and attentive waiter brought bread/oil right away, & upsold me to the sangria flight which was SO good. Pizzas/salads are consistent here and we like them enough to come back when we eat out with the kiddos.

i usually come here for business meetings as lunch is not to crowded and the wait staff is really friendly. the food is always decent, but the wait staff is the reason why we keep having meetings here.

This place was great at first.... Until the server came with her nasty attitude. My friends and I tried to brush it off as we trusted that the fabulous food will put us back in the mood... we were very wrong. IT WAS DISGUSTING. The pizza was stone hard. We were very dissatisfied with the service, as well as, the food. To top our experience off, the waitress cheated us. Now it was not a human error because we counted the money multiple of times. We did not talk to the manager because we didn't want to stir up another argument with this terrible waitress. I would not give this place one star. ABSOLUTELY DISSATISFIED. I do not recommend coming here at all!!!!

Arrived on a Friday after golfing nearby. Parking was filling up but was fortunate to secure a spot in the complimentary parking lot. Was seated immediately and ordered a mango strawberry beverage  and started off with the smoked veggie salad and followed with the original BBQ chicken pizza. The full salad was tasty, loaded with smoked artichoke hearts, avocado, eggplant, asparagus, peppers and Dijon balsamic vinaigrette. The pizza arrived hot just after nearly finishing the salad and was also yummy.  For being a big box restaurant CPK is consistent on service, quality with healthy alternative choices.

Food is awful. If you're gonna charge high prices make sure your food is high quality and taste good. It was my second visit and looked like my 5 year old niece put it together. Not sure what the hype is about this place. Their pizza looks like and taste like it was frozen and all they did was warm it up.
Great service even though i only ordered to go ! On top of that the food was great ! Delicious thin crust pizza and pasta. Thank you !
Wait was a bit long, but the service and quality of food was great. The thin crust pizzas are definitely better than the hand tossed ones.

OK so my boyfriend and I just got done eating here and can I tell you, the WORST service!!! Our server VALERIE came to our table 2x.... once to take our order then once at the very end to bring my refill and our check... now, I was done with my soda half way through my meal... even the host ANDREW had that "I'm better then everyone, I hate this job" attitude.. omg.. I saw 2 other servers here doing such an amazing job, one guy had nice thick black glasses and another white girl with a bun.. wish I got their names but anyways... food was great! Service sucked..
I love many restaurants, but this restaurant is my favorite one. They have many great food!. I always eat pasta with shrimp. It soo delicious. I hope I can eat it everyday.

By signing in for CPK pizza dough points I got a free appetizer plate today that was worth $5.99. I didn't get the pizza I wanted but oh well I got more for later so that worked out well. My server was the best I didn't get her name. Wish I had. She was a great server really fast. Thank you CPK for another delightful lunch.

I don't want to leave this review but... This was not CPKs finest moment. The food was bland... They've clearly changed the menu since I was last there and the offerings were minimal. I wanted to order a pizza plus a Mediterranean salad (today, which is Sunday ) and was informed that I could only order a Mediterranean salad Monday through Friday. Really???

Just got done with dinner there. Seriously I don't know WHY people would come to this chain. Quality and portions have been going down over the years. I have to come at least once a year because my kids request it on their birthdays but today was the biggest disappointment! We ordered, they got our order incorrect.
