A male that was serving us our food said the wrong names for our dishes which made our whole table confused until we corrected him. I ordered a Kung pao pasta with shrimp... Upon first bite I almost choked because they used SO MUCH SALT I couldn't believe so I had everyone try a taste. It was inedible!!!! How does an establishment like this make this kind of mistake??? I was about to call the manager over to force him and the chef who made it try it but obviously I can't. I flagged down my server and got the bolognese instead. My lips are still stinging from all that sodium. Bolognese is mediocre at best, the fast food bolognese from Fazoli's is way better. Our server tried her best but was very inattentive, we sat there constantly flagging her down and everyone finished their meal by the time I had put in my complaint. I vow to not spend another dollar here. If my kids want to come in the future, I'm talking them out of going. I considered speaking to the manager about all these small issues but didn't want to ruin my sons birthday dinner. I'm home and had to drink 3 glasses of water because my tongue is all shriveled up.

I would typically give them 5 stars, but my boyfriend and I decided to try takeout tonight and when we got home we were both disappointed. Our spaghetti was dry no sauce at all and we ordered the Avocado rolls and they forgot to give us the dipping sauce which is what makes them amazing ! Needless to say after a long day of work and driving all the way to chino hills from Eastvale we weren't happy. It definitely was not our money's worth.
The service is excellent. Staff is friendly. They have a lot variety for vegetarians. Their soup and pizzas are really good. This the allergen menu link from their website.

Our waitress Keira must have been having one hell of a night cause her attitude was very apparent. 3 stars for the 2 guys who came by that weren't our waiters who were very helpful. The food was good and quick to come out so major props to the kitchen ! We wanted to order dessert but she brought out our check without asking if we wanted anything else. The final exchange when she brought our receipts to sign was really awkward as she didn't say anything to us other than placing them on the counter and walking away. Probably not going back here after this.

Great casual place to eat. Strawberry mango drink is very refreshing but no refills. Hubby ordered the BBQ chicken pizza & wedge salad very yummy. I got the garlic cream fettuccine with mushrooms & it was very good. Place was clean & had flat screens by the bar. Prices are reasonable. So far good service. They have a rewards program so don't forget to sign up for it.
One of my favorite restaurant in Chino Hills. And, I'm so glad they brought back my favorite pizza: carne asada. Eating it with my favorite drink: Mango ice tea.

I went here for dinner a few days ago and got seated by the hostess outside on the patio, since I had a dog.  After waiting for our waiter for 35 minutes, I finally went inside and asked the hostess (a different one) if she could send someone outside to take our order, since we've been waiting for over 30 minutes for someone to come to our table.  She apologized, and told me that she forgot to tell the wait staff that we were outside on the patio.   ??? I brushed it off, because she was nice and very apologetic, but after we finally got a waiter over to our table, he came to take our order and we never saw him again.  No refills, didn't even bring us plates for our pizza, no silverware,never cleared out our dirty dishes,  etc.  By the time we tracked down a different waiter, after going inside again, and someone DIFFERENT bringing us out plates, they were dirty with left over food on them.    The food was good, the staff was friendly,  but the two hour "quick lunch" for two people sharing a pizza wasn't worth it.  The horrible service on a non busy day, was not worth the wait and basically ruined our whole meal.  No tip was given that day.

Great tasty food, nice decorations although the service was slow the first time i came the service was nice the waitress was kind and fast, and she give me a free cheese bread was good, but the second time was not as good as the first one, although the food was better in the dubai branch.

This is a good place to go if you want a good salad. Oddly enough, even though it's "California Pizza Kitchen" the pizzas are bla here! It's kinda ironic too because on their menu, the pizzas are on a small tiny flap and hard to even notice. The pizza dough reminds me of dominos. Over ten years ago there was  a delicious pizza, rosemary chicken potato, but it is long gone from he menu! Dining in is hit or miss. Sometimes the servers are awesome, and most of the time they are forgetful and inattentive. Hopefully you dine with someone who you have great convo  with. My friend and I usually laugh because we always ask for them to bring oil and vinegar for the complimentary bread, and usually whatever random server we get forgets.  Today I got a to go order of the chicken tequila fettuccini and the turkey and Brie sandwich. The gentleman who handed me food and rang me up was great. Before he ran my card be verified my order. (I hate when places mess up my food and I get disappointed when I don't notice until I'm home). I'm assuming he was in charge considering he had a dress shirt on and not the cpk uniform.  I was disappointed by my sandwich. I've ordered this sandwich before, but today they were extra stingy with the turkey. It was pretty much a bread sandwich. Wompwomp. Where has all the turkey gone? :/

We're regulars here. There wasn't a lot of customers dining tonight but Must have been an off night because the service was sub-par. Our server took our order, delivered the food and drinks but then disappeared. We had to ask a different server for drink refills, to go box, bill etc. We'll go back but if service continues to be bad, we will find another CPK to dine at!  PS: 3 stars for tonight was real generous bc of past good experiences.

VALERIE is the best server ever! I was immediately greeted by the hostess (sorry don't remember her name) and Valerie came right away so I could order my drink. I got the frozen original lemonade, and the garlic cream fettucine and the fire grilled ribeye in medium rare. Everything was really delicious and the service seems to keep getting better since the first time I came here after moving to Chino Hills. Their butter cake won't ever disappoint you. Will come back again!

I've been coming here for god knows how long and everytime i say oh next time will be better we'll guess what? I'm not saying that today! I ordered the same salad I always get and it comes out the same crappy like usual. I canceled the meal i didn't even want to go complain to the manager again. Well If you like crappy food be my guest! Come over to CPK!!

I am still adapting to a lot of the changes that were made to CPK in the last 2 years, but I'm doing a lot better with the changes!  We visited 2 weeks ago and we were completely impressed with the flavors of the food (even the bread).  The pasta, the pizza, the asian salad, the kids pasta - it was all delicious!  What I love the most is the great service you received from the moment you arrive.  The Hellos and Good-Byes really make the world of difference for us.  We have lived near this location for 5 years now and we will continue to visit as long as the quality and service remains.
Like most of the other reviewers said, service here is very sub-par, I will not be returning. The manger Romelia is a lovely lady and took over and saved the night out. Shame.

Love pizza, but hate bad service. Was seated quickly, waitress took too long to take our order. After our meal arrived waitress never checked on us. Finished our meal and waited probably 20 minutes for the check. May not return because of service.
My family came here for the first time tonight and it was amazing! Brian was our server and he was very helpful, attending, and nice:) The food was sooo good! Someone give Brian a raise!!!!

Came in on Monday 12/26 around 6pm. We called ahead and asked how long the wait is for a party of 5, they said no wait.. 1st strike.. we waited 20 mins. We were sat down and the server didnt show up for another 10 mins to take our drink order. It took forever to get our drinks and the server took another 20 mins to take our food order. everyone ordered pasta or a pizza and i ordered the half order chicken Caesar . Other tables were getting their order including a bigger party that was seated before us. Finally after a half hour,  everyone received their food but me. How do you forget a salad?! i waited 15 mins for the server to come by and she looked at the table and said oh half of you received your food and half of you didnt? I told her wrong, everyone got their food but me, and its a pretty basic salad. It finally  came out about 5 mins later and now im really pissed because the chicken was extremely raw. Im not talking a little pink, I mean the same kind of raw look when you purchase it raw from the store. They took it back and asked for them to just get me a new one and put it in a to go box since my party was done eating. the manager came out with a free avocado egg roll plate to make things better but not really since the table is pretty much vegan. they gave me a full size salad to go and a free cake which was nasty. The raw chicken and service ruined the CPK experience and we wont be coming back for the horrible service and raw food

We came to cpk today (1/2/17 at 430 pm) and our waiter was Hugo! He was beyond awesome! Great personality and service!! Hope his manager reads this cuz he made our dinner so enjoyable. Not once did we have to ask for refills. I praised him to the hostess and asked for her to rely the message to the manager. The hostess told me he's actually a bus boy and will be a waiter in the next couple of weeks. I'd say he's beyond ready! Thank you Hugo!

It was a Friday night when my roommates and I went to eat here. It was a spur of the moment thing and we were indecisive as is about where we wanted to eat. We expected the wait to be long but it only took 5 minutes for us to be seated. That was the best part of the whole experience. When we sat down our server came 5 minutes later to take our drink order and our food order. This poor guy seemed so frazzled. I felt bad for him being a Hospitality major and knowing how the restaurant works. He seemed so stretched out and the restaurant itself seemed to be the same way staffing wise. I gave this a 3 because the service was bad but the food was good so it balanced it out to a neutral 3. I won't ever go back to this location though. That was my first time and now I have the perception that that'd be the same bad service experience I'd continue to get. You usually get 2 chances but reading these other reviews solidifies that perception to be true and therefore I will not go again.

+ Wild Mushroom Pizza w Truffle Oil + Eggs Sunny-Side Up + Sourdough Bread w Olive Oil & Spices + Overall Service: Hostess opens the door wide open for you upon entry/exit We came here for the first time in a long time this past year and have frequented the spot ever since. Service is pretty awesome and I have yet to find a complaint. The thin crust wild mushroom pizza with truffle oil (+$1.50) is pretty amazing and you can take it up another notch by adding eggs (+$1.50) to your pizza sunny side up (only possible if they have other seasonal dishes that require the kitchen to carry eggs). The complimentary bread and oil are inexplicably good. The Pesto pasta dish was light, well seasoned, and tasty.  The Chicken Tequila Fettuccine was also good but a bit on the thicker, oilier, heavier side ranking it overall second to the pesto pasta in my book. Service has always been great. It's great to have and see the hostess run out to open the door and greet you as you walk in. The servers are all amicable and professional from what I've experienced. The kitchen staff deserves to be recognized as the last time we were there, they issued us a heads-up when they brought out our pizza that the pizza was a bit overcooked on one side (slightly blackened but still acceptable) and a new pizza was already being fired up on the house.  Bonus tip: The patio area was a  relatively quiet area to meet for a 1:1 business lunch meeting.  Bonus tip: There is a bicycle lock rack by Bruxie if you are local and want to transport by bike there.

Perfect timing for beating the dinner rush.   As we walked into the door, our host greeted with a smile and proceeded to ask how many was in our party.   She then quickly seated us and indicated that our waitress Janey will be our server tonight.  Before as she walked away, she said, "Have a wonderful dinner".  Now that's how Good host should be!  They are the first to make a good impression or a bad one. Our server Janey and trainee Hugo was very attentive and accommodating.  They both made sure that we were never unattended.   Great service and food has gotten better than the past.

CPK is one of my favorite spots and the Chino Hills location is perfect! The service is always friendly and the food is always amazing.  This specific visit we sat at the high top tables in the bar area. Half booth and half chair seating. It was either this or wait so we were fine with it. This area is nice because you have a view of the entire restaurant and the TVs too. The only downside was that the server is the same person that is bartending which could get a little busy. Even then, she was super nice and apologized when there was no fresh bread. Which was not a problem because by the time we got ours it was hot and freshly baked.  We usually order the thin crust spinach and artichoke pizza and a salad but this time we switched it up with the chicken tequila pasta! Whoa boy, the pasta was yum! A tad al dente but just about perfect. Plus a couple glasses of wine hit the spot. CPK is the perfect lunch or dinner spot for California/Italian and drinks. I will be back again and again and again and again and....

California Pizza Kitchen was one of my favorite restaurants to visit however after my last visit at the Chino Hills location I cannot say I will be returning. My family and I went to CPK during lunch time. We were seated and had our order taken fairly quickly however there were only 5 tables filled in the entire restaurant so we expected service to be quick. Our visit began to go bad when we received flat sodas. We then waited 40 minutes before our waiter came over to our table to confirm what we had ordered and it had turned out that our order was put in incorrectly. At this point we were very upset that it had been so long since we had placed our order and the waiter was barely asking us to confirm the order. About 5 minutes later the waiter brought out two of our three dishes and one of those dishes was incorrect even though he had just confirmed our order. The waiter apologized and brought out the correct salad for the order. After another few minutes our last plate was brought out also incorrectly. The waiter apologized once again stating that the kitchen was backed up and made a mistake. The waiter then corrected the mistake after a while longer. My family and I were very upset and confused as to why the kitchen was backed up and making so many mistakes when the restaurant was almost completely empty. After being in the restaurant for over an hour and a half for what my family and I were expecting to be a quick and pleasant lunch we left the restaurant disappointed and with no desire to return to this location.

I had an amazing experience last night at dinner with my family and wanted to Say a big THANK YOU to Katy our server. She did a great job and is the type of person I love to have as a server. She brought extra special attention to my 3yr old daughter which allowed me to actually enjoy my dinner. I would love to hire someone like Katy. She gave 110% to her job! Thank you.

One of our favorite all time go-to restaurants for pizza, salad and pasta. Servers are always friendly and helpful. Everything my family and I would order always comes out right, tasty and delish. Meal portions are just right and often shareable. This time, hubby and I tried their Valentine special for $35 (choice of one appetizer - spinach artichoke dip, two meal entrees (mushroom sausage pizza/garlic cream chicken fettuccine and one dessert-butter cake w/ ice cream). The dessert, as recommended by our server literally melts in your mouth! So glad we got to try it. Meal price was affordable esp for Valentine's Day and we weren't disappointed. Will come back again and again.

I recently was here with my mother n law and as friendly and kind the servers are, they lack in something. for example, my mother n law who is 87 asked for water. she then asked again explaining she was really thirsty. The water did not come until server felt like bringing it. Today I'm at curbside, again sweet kind young man. once at curbside I asked him to bring change for $60 (bill over $40. He did not. now I had to wait for him to go back in. grrrr.

Located in Chino Hills this CPK is a pretty clean and nice place. Since I've been to this place a few times within a year and half they have switched and replaced menu items.  Came back in here because they have some sort of rewards program you just have to sign up inside and then after use your phone number.  Ordered a new dish of Asian dumplings which comes with six. It was different and soft. Full of a lot of different flavor mixed in.  Also had the steak that was cooked very well. It comes with arugula and also roasted potatoes. I thought this dish was a pretty good portion and something fun to eat.  They are known for their pizza and yes I do sometimes order that as well, but sometimes you just want to try other dishes.  Plenty of choices for everyone in the family so I think this is a pretty good spot for lunch or dinner.  The only thing I would say is sometimes it takes a bit long to get the food.
A great place to bring the family , excellent food and service and friendly staff

The chino hills location is fantastic! Been coming here for a while now and each time the food is great the staff are all cool and the service is fast. Glad i came to this location on my first date with my long time boyfriend

My family frequent this location. We visit weekly! Today was the best visit we have ever had. Our server Monique was very sweet, attentive, and quick with all of our requests. The most notable point was the manager's (Phil) effort to ensure all customers are well taken care of and he very involved.. we constantly saw him walking around, assisting servers, and checking on every customers.. we received our mushroom spinach flat bread with hardly any spinach or mushrooms. We are not ones to complain.. surprisingly, less than ten minutes later the manager Phil came and apologized for the skim toppings and gave us another one simply because he personally saw how it was prepared before it was brought out to us. He is definitely a hands on manager! It is amazing that he noticed and gave us another plate that looked much much better without us even saying anything... Monique was very sweet, Phil was amazing, and the food tasted the best today! Keep up the great work Monique and Phil!

Every time I come here it's a hit or miss. I've been coming to this CPK for maybe 5 years now and I keep coming back because I love something from nearly every section of their menu. What gave me the urge to leave a review, though, are poor take-out experiences. The past 2 times I've had to wait 10, even 15+ minutes past the time they told me for pick up. This time they were nice enough to offer me a drink for waiting (the mango iced tea is SO good). I've been here for a birthday dinner of mine and everyone had a great time, when I was in high school I would go here after school after every rally, and even eat dinner before school dances. Other times with friends or family though, orders have been messed up half the time, drinks would be empty for awhile, or it would seem like we were forgotten about if we sat outside. Wish I could give at least 4 stars, but I'm stuck at 3 stars.

Excellent experience!  An amazing staff! My family and I came out this way to see the wildflowers at the state park and afterward decided to do lunch nearby.  We called CPK to ask about wait time and Tiffany was so delightful and informative and asked if she could take our name down on the waitlist as we headed toward the restaurant.  She had a table ready and waiting for us when we walked in! On a bustling Sunday afternoon, mind you.  While dining, our server Jamie was just perfection. So kind, attentive, knowledgeable, bubbly and patient. We have two young children and my grandma has a severe pepper allergy which she catered to seamlessly.  In addition, we could tell that all of the other employees were really team oriented, hands-on, and just all around fantastic.  Such a great team here and fantastic lunch experience. Thank you Chino Hills CPK!  We will definitely be back whenever we're in the area!

First time here and I have to admit best experience ever had ,  Our server Melissa was very friendly and attentive. She mentioned to her general manager that we were first timers and we than were greeted by him and also gave us a complimentary salad .very delicious by the way ..  Thanks for the great service we will definitely be back soon !!!

Extremely rude and unprofessional hostess named Madi. I love CPK but with this terrible service happening I doubt I will ever come back. She would ignore you if your waiting to give your name and then when someone else walks in she takes their name first and continues to ignore you!!! Even after I told her i had been waiting and she took 2 other that walked in after me she still put me last on the list. She did this to a family of 4 right before but since they did not speak english they didnt speak up. Im so disgusted by the way she treats people.

Every CPK I go to always has amazing service! Servers are so friendly and attentive. The food is also consistently good, and it doesn't take long to get a table or for your food to arrive. To start off, you always get fresh bread with olive oil. Great way to start the meal and it's an awesome compliment to any pasta dish (don't be afraid to ask for seconds or thirds!). Now for some of the foods I've tried over a few different visits: - Wild Mushroom Pizza - Add on eggs and truffle oil and you've got yourself a fancy upgraded pizza. I'm sure the pizza is great on it's own, but the eggs really take it up a notch! - Garlic Cream Fettuccine - Yummmm. It's a simple, classic pasta dish--can't go wrong here. - Chicken Tequila Fettuccine - Not my favorite, but it's not bad. I think you have to be a big bell peppers lover to enjoy this dish (which I am not). - Pesto Cream Penne - Love this as well! Very tasty and you get a nice kick of flavor from the sun-dried tomatoes too. Overall, I love how consistent their service and food is. CPK is always an awesome lunch option on any day!
Excellent service by Britt. Great food. Nice ambience. Manager is out and about. Nice greeters.

Great experience since the moment we walked in. It was my 15 month old and I. Hostess greeted us with a smile and walked us to our table. Hugo was our server he did an amazing job. Asked me if it was was my first time. Since it was, he briefly went over the menu and answered any questions I had.  Several minutes after he leaves the table a woman dressed as a chef (think it was the manager) brings me a small bbq chicken salad and pasta as  a complimentary welcome dish since it was my first time there. It was tasty and my main dish, the thai crunch salad was absolutely delicious!  I def recommend this restraunt for their food and service. I will be back with my hubby , it will be his first time ...  overall excellent experience.

The service for this location was excellent! My friend and I was craving for pizza and we decided to go there since I had a 50 dollar gift card When I entered the restaurant, we were seated immediately by a server (forgot what her name was but she did an fantastic job). She started off by asking if we went to CPK before but this is our first time at this location. Once we ordered our main entrees, one of the other server gave us free samples of tequila chicken fettuccine and salad (forgot the name of it but it had strawberry and watermelon) since this was our first time in this location. This was very surprising they gave us free food even though we ordered a lot. We ordered the spinach dip for our appetizers and the original BBQ chicken and the works pizza for our entrees. We were unable to finish our pizza so we took it to go but I definitely recommend this place whenever I'm craving for CPK not just for the free food but the excellent service to check if anything was fine and if we're satisfied.

I work in customer service and know how one should be treated if you're going to pay more than $10 for a salad. We went to CPK for dinner after work and got a waitress named Melissa I believe. First off she didn't seem like she was having a good day, I understand that but don't let customers see that. Second, she said she would bring bread to us and took her time as I saw others get their bread pretty promptly. Third, we didn't get refills until before we were getting ready to leave. Fourth of all the waitress told us she was leaving so we had to pay the bill but no rush to leave, I have never been told that in my life usually they introduce another waitress/waiter to attend you further on. I still tipped her but I usually tip more depending on how I'm being taken care of, my friends did not tip because she was not pleasant. As we are leaving and she sees what she made off of tips she says out loud "I hate people" if you do then you should work else where. The food is always good here but the service was not cool this time, disappointed if anything.

Excellent service! Our waiter Michael was very attentive and always made sure we were okay. He never rushed or looked annoyed when asked questions about the menu like other waiters. Very friendly guy! I would highly recommend this restaurant. Great food, drinks, and service.

Always yummy! Our server, Carina, was awesome. She was very attentive. I'm so happy she recommended the carne asada pizza. She was also able to bring out my hungry toddler's Macaroni and cheese before he got wild. We will be back!

Arrived at 425pm, we sat at the bar.  After over 20 minutes of being ignored by the bartender standing right in front of us without even a "hello", I walked over to get a table so we could get something to eat.  We have now been sitting at the table for 10 minutes waiting for the waitress to even come by to introduce herself.  Service has really declined.  This was one of our favorite places to eat, but it has really taken a dive in service quality.

Came here for a lunch. Was seated right away for a group of 7. Service was great. Except a few times when we asked a different waitress for something we were told "I will let your server know." Guess they don't help each other out when it comes to serving tables.  The food was good. Ordered salads and a chicken piccata. The chicken piccata was a bit buttery but still tasty.

Most amazing experience being here for the first time with my daughter. The service was really nice and the server really patient. The food was amazing and they even gave us free samples for me and my daughter. I am definitely coming back to CPK next time.

refills for drinks were fast, but waited an hour for our food while seeing other people being seated and got food before us. Was very inconvenient, especially because the restaurant was not busy at all. Marconi I ordered was cold and stale. Pizza was good
For a quick pizza dinner, appeasing to kids appetite and  adult beverages you can't go wrong.

Our dining experiences at this CPK location were less than pleasant. We feel that the server should have treated all clients with equal courtesy despite their spending levels. We also feel that each food item should have been served with due promptness after it was cooked instead of sitting in the kitchen (waiting for the server to pick up) until it turned lukewarm or even cold. In addition, the bread served as appetizer should have been better made so that its crust is not too tough and thick to eat. We would like to make CPK aware that a lot of times pleasant-tasting food prepared diligently by its hardworking chefs could have been spoiled by the less-than-pleasant service of its servers.

Our party visited CPK just this afternoon. Service was only okay. Their staff is very slow & not that attentive. Our food took 35 minutes to get to our table after ordering. The food is obviously kept waiting in the back because it was not hot nor fresh. They wait till everyones order is complete before serving us our food which made our food cold. The pizza was very tough and not that great. It was difficult to eat because it was stale! If we could rate it a zero, we would. The salad was good.

Came here to celebrate my birthday with my husband and 2 year old  Drinks were delicious  Service was impeccable (Wednesday night= restaurant not too busy) Staff was friendly as always Spinach dip is to die for Spinach Fettuccine was my daughters favorite BUT  The Hawaiian pizza was not all that great Pineapple came in huge chunks and their crust is beyond thin Other than that great job guys Huge shout out to Brian for making my 22nd extra special with a birthday surprise  Def. Coming back for a 3rd time very soon

Love the food here but I'm so disappointed that I specifically came here to order the salted caramel pudding and they are out. Nothing more annoying than a restaurant running out of your favorite item

The restaurant manager is also front drsk host herself. We went to the restaurant on Monday dinner around 7pm and we were seated quickly. we ordered thin crust Jaimacan jerk chicken, Shrimp ($5 for shrimp, $2 for chicken) pesto penne pasta and summer salad with watermelon, strawberry and spring mix. To be honest, Jaimacan jerked chicken pizza  tasted like bbq chicken pizza. But i did like the shrimp pesto penne pasta.  I felt nothing special about spring mixed summer salad.

I recently ate here. I was very pleased with the service. We were seated right away. Berto was very on top of things. He kept our glasses fillled. And he offered us different drinks as a way of upselling but not in an annoying or pushy way. The place was clean and tidy and the foood was great. Thanks for a great experience Berto. I don't usually write reviews but Berto took great care of us. I totally thought it was worth it.

i never thought i'd make a review for CPK not because it's not good but because it's not amazing or bad to where i'd take time to write a review~but today is the tie breaker! the service here is exceptional especially those working at the curbside pick up and the manager today, he was phenomenal and knows how to run this place! they're not stingy with bread or anything you ask for! brought a smile to my face for dinner and my husbands!

I come here for the occasional work lunch with my colleagues and when the wifey and I are craving some CPK chicken picatta(sp? Too lazy to look it up haha).   Food - traditional CPK goodness. My go to's are the Chicken picatta mentioned above, the BBQ chicken pizza, the salads(any of them) and the artichoke dip. Tried a lot of the menu so they really have most options to satisfy most cravings.   Service staff is super friendly here, they are attentive and never mind our large groups when we're here for work.   Located in the shoppes at CH, it's easy enough to get to. However, this specific area can get quite congested at times and you prob won't find parking super close but it wouldn't be too far.

Don't bother coming if you have a baby in a stroller. Twice already I've had experiences with that when the restaurant is not even busy. Once they made me sit outside and the second time only an option for a table was offered.

I normally don't review chains because I feel like it's kind of pointless but the service at this particular CPK really ticked me off. I came in and I ordered the chips & guac , BBQ chicken pizza , and the Tortilla spring rolls. The apps were taking forever to come out but I'll take partial responsibility for that because when she said "all together" I assumed she meant if the food would all be on one bill and not if I wanted all the food to come out at the same time .  While waiting , another young lady who wasn't our waitress came by to refill our waters and ended up making a huge puddle on the table. She apologized and said she would be back to clean it up, she never visited our table again. She came back to the section several times to assist other customers and even stood around socializing with the hostess but never came back. It wasn't until the waitress came with the food that it was taken care of because I asked her for napkins. So that day I learned that apparently the guacamole that comes with Baja chicken tortilla spring rolls and the guacamole served with their chips and guacamole are two different recipes . Stupid , and I had never heard of that. The chunks of diced avocado that they tried to pass off as guacamole was so bad I had it taken away and the manager was kind enough to take it off the bill . I was annoyed because the person I was with had never been to CPK and I was telling them how much I loved their house guacamole but idk what the hell this location is serving , that isn't guacamole. It literally couldn't even get onto the chip , I had to use a spoon. The manager came back and kept trying to plead his case about the guacamole and insisted that whatever CPK I visited in the past was preparing it incorrectly. Okay buddy. Overall the food was good , but the service was disappointing.  The waitress came by the table after we paid and refilled our drinks stating that it was hot out so she just wanted us to be hydrated . Not sure if that is something they do regularly or if she was just trying to make up for whatever happened earlier .  Overall, I expected more from a California Pizza Kitchen that's ACTUALLY in California . Oh well.

Chains are popular for a reason.  Consistency.  We like California Pizza Kitchen, because we know we can expect good, quality food, fairly fast, and for a fair price.  This location is no exception. We came in only 15 minutes before closing and the staff didn't even bat an eye.  No complaints and very chipper. We shared our usual, the BBQ Chopped Chicken Salad and the BBQ Chicken pizza.  I tend to be a creature of habit, and I'm trying to branch out, so I try something new each place now. This time I had the fried mac and cheese appetizer.  All of our food was great.  The appetizer was really good, and I liked that it was filling, but a true small plate.  Not too much. I like CPK for fast casual.  Varied menu, but higher quality than some of the other chains.

I come here quite a bit. The server was good but it took a little over 30mins for pizza and a salad to come out. The Farmers soup which is my fav was not good. The veggies were undercooked. I expect better.

Our utensils and plates were dirty when we received them, and our server ignored us. My drink wasn't even drinkable. Overall the service was really horrible and we were concerned about the level of cleanliness in the restaurant.
Do not do the curb side order on a Friday night. Pick up time 8:02pm actual time of delivery 8:44pn

I went to CPK for an after work cocktail on a payday Friday.    I was a bit surprised to hear CPK DOES NOT DO HAPPY HOUR ON FRIDAYS!!! Wtf?? So I tailored my order to include one (1) glass of wine and an appetizer.   The appetizer was the fried buffalo cauliflower which was so freakin good I could have had 3 more servings.  Val was our server and she Was awesome.   She recommended the buffalo cauliflower appetizer and was very attentive.  I would give CPK a 5 star except they don't have happy hour on fridays!!
Only come to this CPK if you enjoy hearing screaming children.  Seems to be a magnet for oblivious parents with poorly behaved kids.

Went here for the first time with my kids and the host was very friendly, the server was prompt and attentive, both had asked me if I had dined with them before and I said no it's our first time.  After we ordered our lunch the manager came over introduced himself and said he had heard this was our first visit so he took it upon himself to bring us a few sample plates of their most popular dishes on the house.  The service was great and the food was delicious.  We will come back for sure!  Their customer service deserves 10 STARS!!  Way to make a customer feel special!
I didn't have CPK for at least 3 years and came back to dine in to use a gift card. I used to like their Jamaican Jerk chicken pizza. Now, I don't think I'll come back.

The dishes don't look like a lot, but boy do they fill you up. Here's what we ordered for the three of us: -Original BBQ Chopped Salad. The half size was just enough. About 11 bucks. -Farmers Market Soup. The bowl was huge. Mainly focuses on the butter squash. Not my favorite dish, but it was okay. Very thick -Garlic Cream Fettucine. Delicious!! If you're in a creamy mood, go for it. If not, it'll be too greasy for you.  -Half-Half Pizza (California Club & Hawaiian)! Love both & they taste exactly how I imagined.  HEAVY food, but pretty good when you're in the mood.

So price here is not too bad. Definitely much more expensive than fast food pizza, but for a sit down restaurant, it's not bad. Service is pretty slow. They treat you nicely and with respect, but it took us around 15 minutes just to get to-go boxes and another 5 for the check. I mean there are so many workers. The food is okay. I definitely prefer some other alternatives, but I wouldn't reject it if it was provided for me. Salads are pretty good here though. I definitely remember this place being a lot better before, but I don't know...something is really off about this place now.

Expensive,mediocre and again expensive.its been years since I came to a cpk ,15 bucks for a pizza?I rather go to pieolgy. 50 BUCKS for 2 pizzas and a kids pizza that should have came with fries at least.setvice suckex,employees would take out plates while we are still eating off of them.can we finish our Damn food?not coming back,sticking to pieolgy and dominos
Get the California Club Pizza. Bacon cheese pizza topped with fresh arugula and cheese. Salad on pizza! Fresh and always the go-to. The service is always great and HEY free bread!

It's been a while since me and the Mrs have gone to a CPK so it was basically a first impression again for us. The server was courteous and polite but asked if we were ready to order 3 times in like 1 minute. Pissed my wife off cause she took her napkin as if it was trash and it was hardly used. Again it's been a while since coming to a CPK but the prices seemed a bit outrageous, 15 dollars plus tax for a pizza? I can get 3 pizzas and feed a family for the same price. Yikes! Asked for 2 box's and got one. All in all not a horrible experience BUT not a great first impression again. Food was fine but at 15 a pizza I think I needs to be a little more than just fine, maybe give a side as well. Probably won't be returning again anytime soon

My first meal after fasting for Navratri for 9 days. We stopped in at this location for lunch on our way to Moorpark. The restaurant wasn't too busy and we were sat immediately. [Customer Service] Our waitress Monique was the best. She was quick to take our drink orders and come back to take our food order. She was serving about 4 other booths in our row but kept up with everyone's orders and refills.  She also even stopped by to inform us about the new entrées and dessert. [Our Order] Spicy Buffalo Cauliflower: sooo good you couldn't even tell it was cauliflower. Well balanced spices.  Kung pao spaghetti: my go to order at CPK. So yumm and spicy.  Lunch combo- Chicken meatball paizanno with split pea soup: delicious. Half and half of each. Good portion size.
Review for take out only- Order for 8. Was told to pay at the bar. No plates, 2 forks and 1 bag of bread for entire order. People just  don't have common sense anymore. Or they're just cheap!

CPK is just not what it used to be.  Music is TOO loud to have a conversation without yellling.  We ordered the BBQ chicken salad and a bowl that has some healthy vegies and quinoa in it.  The salad wasn't tasty and the chicken was tough and didn't taste fresh.  The bowl was not even half filled with vegies and could hardly find the quinoa.  Got the butter cake for desert and that was good, but with a scoop of ice cream was more than $11.  Sorry, but these once good chain restaurants need to go.

Came here on a weekday around 4, this place was not busy at all. But service was very slow.  Can someone tell me why it took 25 minutes for us to get bread? Or why the chick dressed in business casual had time to stand around chatting and checking her phone periodically instead of getting us said bread? Our waiter only checked in on us once and that was because I flagged him down to ask for things we needed. He was nice but I think the only waiter working.  The food was good. But I'll surely remember the slow service before coming back here.
The lunch duos are a pretty good deal. Good service, to match the good food. CPK is a safe bet for a satisfying meal for lunch or dinner.

Came here this afternoon because I was craving pizza, customer service was great but the food was disappointing.  I ordered the lunch combo and to begin with it took about 40 minutes to arrive at our table and the pizza was not even warm.  The baked potato soup was decent but it was very upsetting that I had to pay 15 dollars for pizza that was not even hot or appetizing you could see the grease coming out of it.  I don't think I will be coming back but that's just my opinion.

Just like the other CPK's, everything is good. The only problem I had was we were only visited by our server once. We had to flag down someone else to get service. Other tables were visited by their servers several times. And we were seared at the darkest place on earth so we couldn't read what we were ordering, had to use a flashlight, lol. So because of that, we're not coming back here.

My friend and I came in to order take out for her birthday lunch, and the service was exceptional. We were greeted by a woman name Romelia and what a sweet woman she is. She took her time with each of our orders, never once rushed us and made the wait fly by. Not only did she added a chocolate cake for her birthday but she even went the extra step to add candles to it! She is so kind and you can tell she loves her job. She even shared some neat facts about CPK and the fresh steps they take to make our food so delicious! I will definitely be going back and I just might order take out again just to experience her wonderful customer service.
The worst place to get a drink? Is this glass half empty or half full lol GEE guess what i think for $15 martini? It's empty! Not worth the money

First time eating at this restaurant got the idea from channel 5 news on of their reporters was doing a segment at one of the restaurants and everything they were showing looked good. I decided that night to have dinner. The staff was super friendly.  Hard to select one dish every thing sounded good! Our waiter Michael made some suggestions on what to try and he was absolutely right we enjoyed it! We will definitely be returning soon.

Costumer services from the manager (Adrian) is top rated! Had an issue with a take-out dish, he took care of it immediately as promised. Definitively earn my business. Ordered pizza and pasta , all taste great! Portion is small, order extra to feed the family.  Easy curb side parking, short wait time.

My mom, sister and I got together for a girls afternoon for  lunch and shopping. My sister and I hadn't been here for a few months and my mom hadn't been to this location in a long time. We were all really hungry, so it took awhile to figure out what we wanted. My mom orders soup everywhere she goes. We always try n convince her to try something else. After a long perusing of the menu n specials, we opted for the specials. We tried the shrimp scampi pizza for the 3 of us to share. It got really quiet in the room when the pizza arrived, because we were busy devouring it. It was delicious! The thin crust doesn't weigh you down and.... the flavors were amazing! My mom convinced us she really wanted the butternut squash soup, so we told her to enjoy. And she did, right to the bottom of the bowl. My sister n I shared the wild mushroom strozzapreti pasta dish with cremini and portebello mushrooms. It was fantastic! My sister n I are total mushroom fans. Would def order that again. The finale was the dessert, since we all shared our dishes. We again went with the seasonal special.  The pumpkin cheesecake.  The thick crunchy, buttery crust.  The creamy mousse- like pumpkin flavored cheesecake, and the fresh whipped cream.  We all had just enough for a few bites each. We walked out of there feeling happy and content, with our bellys full, and happy with our choices.  It's a bit pricey of a place for our normal kind of everyday type of lunch, but we will be back again..... sooner than later.

We hosted a birthday party for kids and it was so good . Great food , ambience and hosts . They arranged the Party so well .... gave the Kids a tour of the kitchen and pantry . Kids got to make their own pizza!! Overall a 5 *

This place is horrible once it comes to service. I have been to this place many place because it's right around my house. My waitress Gabriela sucks. Waited forever to take my order once I got my food not once she came over to check. No refills I had to ask one of the other staff to look for her. I had to ask for the bread and I didn't even get it, ended up leaving without finishing my dinner so I was so thirsty.  Never coming back to this location ever again.

Came here with the extended family for mom in law's birthday since she loves trying new food other than Asian. *(hint: she's Asian)  It was jam packed with really young girls trying to look like they're 21 but you can tell they're 15, which made me a bit sad; why be in a hurry to be a "woman" and not enjoy the innocence of youth?  Anyways, jam packed restaurant, waited about 10 minutes and got seated.  Place is hella dimmed, which I figure they did in on purpose for date nights so women will look more attractive in the dark for the guys.  (Or vice versa)  Server came quickly and jotted our order down.  It's your standard corporate owned fancy, "gourmet" wood fired pizza experience.  Hasn't change much in a decade; the bbq chicken pizza still tastes good, mom in law got steak, which was a weird choice but found out it was actually a good freaking steak, go figure from a pizza joint.  Tried sister in law's pasta, which was flavorful and wife got carne asada pizza which tasted like carne asada taco except with flat dough.  Surprise of the night was buffalo style cauliflowers; I know, how are you going to charge so much for buffalo style wannabee VEGGIES?  Believe me, I bit and it was actually pretty good!  Did it taste like chicken?  Of course not, but it was pretty good seasoned veggies.  Bread was tough as a brick but what do you expect, you don't come here for soft, free bread.  Go to Olive Garden for that.

Been here a few times now and I haven't been impressed. I've been to other CPKs and I feel like the kitchen lacks something here. We ordered a pizza and it was soggy which did not make it appetizing. Customer service is good can't complain about that just think the kitchen needs a little work.

Food always up to their standard  -however service Is terrible- the fat tall glasses Mexican guy that serve our table of 13 have the worst Attitude ever- he basically disappear most of the time and give us a bad attitude whenever we request something

Just had their brie turkey sandwich.  Service was good but their sandwich was very thin on the brie.  I ordered it because of it, and I barely tasted it.  I opened up the sandwich to make sure it's there, and I saw that the sandwich had a very thin line of it.  I have no idea how they sliced/melted such thin slice of brie, at least that's impressive. 2 stars for the food, 4~5 stars for service.

Wow,  What a great dinner and service. So we got some gift cards and we'd never been there so we went and got the roasted salad and mushroom pizza both were great and service was very attentive. They even kicked in a few apps because we both had never been there. They all were awesome we were thoroughly happy. Glad we have more gift certificates so we'll be back soon.

I am not really the type of customer to complain. I can wait patiently for my food and still be the most respectful customer one can ever have. I have a clear mind on how things are run. Once seated at the bar, the manager attentively gave us some bread and drink. It was after 1:30!pm so lunch hour was trickling down. Yet our food have not arrived for the last 30mins. Now thats a long wait and my patience ran out. There must be a breakdown of organizational skill inside the kitchen. I have eaten at some fanciest  and not so fancy restaurant when its the busiest, rush hour of hungriness. Yet each time, these venues never failed to deliver the best of services. Upon almost walking out, the manager was very apologetic and so was the server. But enough waiting time was enough. Should I give credit to these two people? Nahhhh, they would have pushed and delivered our food in a timely manner. They only paid attention to our food when we were about to leave. So they ran out of points in this aspect too. No thumbs up. Incidentally, i cant post my review without a star. So there you have it folks..

This is my 1st time visiting this great restaurant.  I've had Christina as my waitress, She was more than amazing, Best service I've had  For years.. She watched our table real well, To make sure to fulfill all our needs. She even helped me setting up a surprise birthday to my girl without her noticing. This girl deserves 20 stars, not only 5! Highly recommend this place, make sure u ask for Christina!! Regarding the food, it was a bit pricy, but was compensated with the high food quality.

Came in at 2:30 for a late lunch. There was no hostess to be found,  so I sat myself at the bar,  waited for  over 10 minutes  for someone to take my order,  I finally  had to flag someone down  to place my order.....after 10 minutes of placing my order,  a waitress came to take my order again.. Anyway the place was not busy at all,  but the staff looked like a Hot Mess.... This is my second time at a CPK....First time was a 2 yrs. ago,   Also a bad experience....Don't think I'll be back..

This is a very good restaurant, it serves pizza and more!  The second of January, the service was crazy slow. I understand though because it is super packed today. I recommend this place and come with patience!

The service here was great. You can tell that the staff reflects off of the great attitude and energy portrayed by the manager Ryan. The food was great and the service was extremely fast. The staff was constantly checking in on the guests and making sure that the restaurant was running smoothly. Our waiters Cody, Roberto and Ralph were very professional and made great conversation start to finish. Nothing but great things to say about this CPK.
As usual the service was great it satarted out rocky but they came through with 5 stars. The manager Adrian pulled through and gave them the 5 stars servers where Tiffany and Michael great job guys
Went because someone gave us a gift card... it was ok it wasn't bad... we really enjoyed our bread.  What made the experience pleasant was our waiter Jason. He was pretty cool.
